11.content:
Here's some characters I've come up with. Feel free to add your own!

1) Jeremy (13) and Austin (9). Austin has always felt that his older brother Jeremy is a bit of a bully. He uses his age and size advantage to force him into doing things he doesn't want to do, and to always get his way. Since Jeremy became a teenager, it's gotten even more stand-offish. However, Austin's life is about to change when, while walking home from school one day, he finds a glowing rock on the ground, a rock that seems to have some interesting effects on him...

2) Collin (16) and Cody (14). Collin and Cody are as close as two brothers could be. Not only are they each other's best friends, but they also each have a slight crush on the other, though neither have the courage to admit it. When they take a mini-vacation together though and share a bed because of it, they end up exploring their feelings with each other, and discover that they have a certain chemistry together... a growing chemistry, if you will...

3) Patrick (17), Nick (12), and Nate (12). Patrick knew this his twin younger brothers Nick and Nate were actually adopted, but he nor anyone else in his family ever really knew the truth of where they actually came from. On the twins' twelfth birthday, when they suddenly start to sprout up at a rapid pace, Patrick discovers he's in for quite an interesting and hair-raising experience...

111.content:
"What a jerk!" Austin kicked a pebble, sulking to himself as he walked along the sidewalk. He had just been playing video games in his house when Jeremy, his thirteen year old brother came in and booted him off the TV, claiming 'bigger brother privileges'. To Austin, that sounded like bullcrap, but since Jeremy was nearly a foot and a half taller than him and could pick him up by the armpits and drag him outside, it didn't really matter what he thought about it.

The brisk fall air blew through his hair, causing him to shiver. He didn't have a chance to grab his jacket before leaving, so he was out here slightly cold. Sure, he could go back inside, but Jeremy would certainly give him grief about it. If only there was a way to turn the tables a little, and make him see what it would be like to be the little brother for a change. But, without a miracle, Austin knew that could never--

His thoughts were interrupted as his eyes caught a light streaking through the early evening sky. "Is that a shooting star?" Austin wondered aloud. He'd only heard about them before, never seeing one in person, and he thought it was especially weird to see one when it was so light out. Furthermore, there seemed to be something peculiar about just how this shooting star, if that's what it was, was traveling. However, he remembered what his mom had once told him about making a wish on a shooting star, and with all his frustration with his older brother boiling up inside of him, he figured it was worth a shot.

"I wish I could be the bigger brother for once, and let Jeremy get a taste of his own medicine."

Nothing seemed to change at first, and Austin felt his heart start to sink. "Shouldn't have gotten my hopes up," he muttered, looking back down at his feet and sighing. As he turned his head upward again, though, he dropped his jaw as he saw that the path of the object flying through the sky had seemed to shift slightly, now headed directly towards him! He began to feel a little frightened, but as it got closer, he realized that the object had been much closer than he had thought it was all along, and it really was very small, finally crashing into the ground about a hundred feet from him, leaving a small trail of smoke behind.

He ran over to the crash site, seeing the small crater that had formed around ... whatever it was. As he peered into the crater, he saw a small hard object, almost like a stone, at the center of it. It looked to be about as big as a quarter and twice as thick, but the most amazing thing about it was that it glowed a bright blue! It was almost entrancing, as if the light from the stone beckoned him to pick it up.

As he did so, he felt a small shock run up and down his arm, nearly dropping the object back down. However, the spark was more startling than painful, and after a few seconds, he began to feel a surging sense of energy build through him. Whatever the stone was, he thought, so far it was having some pretty neat effects!

Little did he know that those effects were just getting started...

11111.content:
Of course, Jeremy didn't give even a word of gratitude when Austin delivered the ice cream, his attention entirely focused on the TV. Austin didn't know why he expected anything, but he still felt a little peeved. Clenching his fists in anger, he turned around and stormed up to his room, knowing he would probably feel bummed about this for the rest night.

Instead, though, Austin seemed to get sleepier much earlier than normal, already yawning at just 8:00pm. Luckily, he had finished his school work earlier in the afternoon, so he decided to go to bed early. "I hope I'm not coming down with anything," he thought, stripping off his clothes and changing into his pajamas. He was momentarily surprised that they felt tighter than they normally did, and looking down at his stomach, he noticed that the bottom of his shirt just barely met the top of his pants, and his ankles were now exposed, even though the legs of the pants used to reach all the way to his heels . Shrugging, he wrote it off as a sign of either havig a nice little growth spurt, or someone messing up on the last laundry day.

As he picked up his pants from the floor, he remembered the stone from his pocket, and pulled it out. The glow was still there, although in the darker room it seemed to have dimmed somewhat. "Well, at least something cool happened today," he muttered to himself. Looking around his room, he tried to decide where he could put the stone, but nowhere appeared to be safe enough to keep from being seen if his brother butted in some point during the night.

Finally, he decided to just put the stone under his pillow, covering it so that the blue glow wouldn't keep him awake. Crawling under the sheets and laying down, Austin closed his eyes, thinking about what life would be like if the tables were turned and he was the bigger one for once. "I'd love to see Jeremy's face if that happened," he murmured to himself, a slight smile forming on his face as he drifted off to sleep.

Throughout the night, the blue stone continued to pulse and glow, as Austin's body continued to slowly grow...

113.content:
"Happy Birthday to you! Happy Birthday to you!!"

Patrick sat at the patio table as his mother stepped out of the kitchen holding the cake, loaded with twenty-four candles, twelve bunched together per side. She sat the cake in front of Nick and Nate, Patrick's twin brothers, who both looked at it eagerly, ready to blow out their set of candles.

"Happy Birthday Nick and Naaaate!"

Of course, Patrick knew that Nate and Nick weren't his biological brothers, but instead had been adopted when he was five. It was fairly obvious; both boys had red hair and pale skin, while Patrick and his parents had a more tan complexion with darker hair. He vaguely remembered the two of them coming home as babies, but since he knew them from such a young age, he figured it was more or less how any other set of brothers would behave, especially twins. He would give them a hard time and they would gang up on him, but overall they got along fairly well, and the fact that they weren't actually related by blood didn't seem to matter much.

"Happy Biiirthday to yoooooou!"

Today, the were celebrating their twelfth birthdays, a day that both of them had looked forward to for weeks. Though their parents had offered to throw them a party, they declined, instead wanting to just have a simple family gathering with none of their friends. Patrick figured it was just as well; though he got along okay with the twins, the kids their age that they hung out with were another story altogether.

The song had been finished for several seconds, and Patrick and his parents watched in anticipation, though Nick and Nate seemed to be taking their sweet time blowing out the candles. Finally, impatience got the best of Patrick. "Well? What are you waiting for?" he asked.

Grinning, Nick and Nate replied by finally blowing out their candles, each getting them all out with little effort. Patrick's parents applauded, and, though he rolled his eyes, he smiled, clapping along with them.

"So what'd you each wish for?" he asked as his mom started to cut the cake.

"Wish?" Nate asked, a grin still on his face.

"Yeah, didn't you guys make a wish?" Patrick said, giving him a questioning look. "That's what you're supposed to do on your birthday, ya know!"

Nick adjusted his glasses, the one obvious identifying trait that separated him from Nate. "Well, I don't think it matters what we wished. The two of us already know what's going to come true."

This confused Patrick even more. "What? What are you talking about?"

The twins exchanged glances, looking as if they knew something Patrick didn't. "Well, let's just say that this birthday is something special," Nate finally replied. "It's about time we grow up, don't you think?"

Patrick squinted his eyes and tilted his head. "I guess. I mean, twelve isn't exactly teenager, yet, but you're getting close. Don't worry about becoming an adult too quickly."

Nick giggled. "No, that's not quite what we meant. Just... just wait. You'll see what we're talking about."

"Yeah," Nate nodded in confirmation. "Real soon."

As the two of them dived into the pieces of cake in front of them, Patrick felt a shiver run down his spine. What in the world could they possibly mean?
113.title: Patrick, Nick, and Nate

1131.content:
The rest of the evening passed normally after that little bout of strangeness. Patrick had tried to get them to talk about what they had meant but the twins were frustratingly coy about it. When he asked them when they were together they just grinned at each other before looking at him and saying, "You'll see!" and when he cornered them when they were apart (Nick while he was on the way to the bathroom and Nate while he was getting more soda out of the big fridge in the garage) they both responded in different, yet similar ways.

Nick had pushed his glasses up, the frames making a slight clicking sound that tended to get on Patrick's nerves (considering that Nick usually never adjusted them pointedly before saying something unless he was planning on being vague or smart alecky about it), and said, "Well, what do you think happens to boys our age?"

Patrick had thought for a moment before responding, "You...get older?"

Nick had chuckled and shook his head slightly, "Well duh, but what else?"

Patrick didn't appreciate the condescension and barked, "Well how should I know?"

Nick pointed up at him, poking his nose playfully, "See, you wouldn't be so upset if you were smarter. Just wait! Like we said, you'll see!"

He had run off with a giggle after that, locking the bathroom door behind him so Patrick didn't get any ideas about pranking him while he was on the toilet. As for Nate, when Patrick had closed the door leading into the house behind him, blocking it, the little red head had sighed and merely said, "Wait, okay? Don't be so impatient!"

"Why? What's the big deal? Can't you just tell me?" Patrick had asked.

"Well duh, of course I could! But that's no fun." He grinned as he said this, winking at Patrick. "I'll give you a hint though: What do you think happens to boys our age?"

"Not this again..." Patrick had thought, keeping his annoyance down and actually thinking this time. "Let's see...I guess...maybe puberty?"

Nate chuckled and said, "Think about that for a bit."

He had then grabbed a bottle of Pepsi and darted around Patrick, getting back inside the house. Patrick sighed and rubbed his forehead. Sometimes, those two were more trouble than they were worth. "It IS their birthday though, I guess they can have their fun." Patrick murmured to himself, heading back into the house.

Patrick wasn't about to be satisfied until around nine o clock, when their mother had clapped her hands and said, "Alright you two, bed time! Upstairs and brush your teeth, now please, and no complaining!"

The twins sighed in unison and jumped up, running upstairs to the bathroom. Their parents' bedroom was on the first floor, along with the kitchen, dining room, living room, and another bathroom. The second floor was officially the domain of the kids, the only rooms up there being Patrick's room, the twin's room, and the bathroom. Patrick helped his mother clear the dishes and put them in the dishwasher, the sounds of laughter and running water coming from upstairs. "Make sure those two actually go to bed, alright?" Their mother said, sighing slightly. "Those two can be such a handful sometimes I swear! Are you sure you're going to be able to handle them while your dad and I are gone?"

"Mom, please. They're just two little kids. What could possibly go wrong?"

Their parents had been planning on going on a trip for awhile now, though they were being cagey about the reason. It wasn't strictly business and it wasn't pleasure either but they didn't get any clearer than that. Patrick assumed it had something to do with the twins, the trip being planned so close to their birthday and all. She sighed and kissed Patrick on the forehead. "Oh, I know sweetie but I'm a mother. We worry. It's part of the job description."

With the dishes packed away Patrick bade his mother good night and headed upstairs, the lights in the house going off one by one as everyone made their way to their rooms. Patrick planned to stay up for a few more hours yet, surfing the net on his laptop for awhile, when his name was called out in unison by his brother's. It was something Patrick got used to hearing, considering the twins often spoke together and finished each others sentences in a stereotypical twin fashion. "Patrick!"

He stopped and looked into his brother's bedroom. "What's up you guys? Mom said to go to bed, remember?"

Nate chuckled, laying out on his bed, arms behind his head, looking a bit smug. "Yeah, we know. Guess you don't want to know what were talking about earlier then."

Patrick's interest was immediately piqued. He felt like he was walking into a trap but his curiosity was getting the better of him. He stepped into the room and closed the door, locking it. "Okay you two. No getting out of it this time! What's going on?"

Nate glanced casually over at Nick and said, "I dunno, you think we should tell him?"

Nick, who was hugging his knees slightly as he sat on top of his covers, sighed theatrically and shook his head. "Nuh uh. No way. Not in a million years."

Patrick rolled his eyes and said, "Come on you guys! No escape this time. Talk." His tone made it clear the time for games was over.

"Sorry Patty boy but Nick said no way." Nate said, holding his hands up, like there was nothing he could do about it. "Guess you're just gonna have to go back to bed and...wait!"

He suddenly leaped to his feet, holding his hand up, finger extended like he was pointing at the moon. "I've got a great idea! I can't tell you...so how about I show you?"

Nick clapped his hands to his cheeks and said, "Aw man! You found a way around it! Guess I've got no choice now!"

Both boys moved to the center of the room, holding hands. "Ready?" They said in unison, nodding once at each other.

Patrick, starting to lose his temper at all these games, said, "Look you guys, this is getting annoying how about you just....tell me...what's going...on?"

His voice trailed off slightly as he watched his twin brother's bodies suddenly glow with an internal silvery light, their hair rising slightly like they were caught up in a light wind, their eyes closed. The effect only lasted for a second, the twin's eyes opening as the light disappeared. "What...the heck was that?" Patrick asked, unsure of what he had just seen.

"Hold on..just wait...the best part is coming." Nate said, holding up a hand, sounding slightly out of breath.

Patrick watched curiously as his brother's both seemed to pant, their pajama shirts riding up slightly with every deep gulp of hair, their hands still clasped tightly together. After a few minutes, Patrick started to notice something strange...their shirts seemed to be riding up higher as they breathed, slowly showing off more and more of their pale skin, the buttons on their shirts stretching slightly, showing off little ovals of flesh between each button. Patrick's eyes widened as he looked down, seeing the waistband digging in slightly to their bodies, the legs of their pajama bottoms rising up past their ankles, making a slow, smooth trek up their hairless legs. Their feet kept pace, slowly stretching along the carpet, their toes digging in, the feeling from this strange growth obviously pleasing them.

"W-Wow...this feels even better than I thought it would..." Nick murmured, licking his lips a little, the creaking sound of cloth filling the air. Both boys had started out at a rather runty four and a half feet tall but they were both easily cresting five foot even and still growing.

"Mmmmmm yeaaaaah! I don't want this feeling to EVER stop!" Nate said with a grin, taking a particularly deep breath, the ping of a button audible as it popped clear of Nate's top, revealing more of his chest. Nate chuckled appreciatively, his body still steadily expanding. The hems of their tops were now clearing their belly buttons, the sleeves growing ever tighter around their pale arms, seams popping as their thighs grew to be too much for their pant legs.

Patrick could feel his heart racing as the twins swiftly approached his height of six feet, the sound of ripping cloth and lost buttons rising into a cacophony around him. He took a step back, Nate's hand quickly grabbing his and holding tight, yanking him closer. "No, no, you wanted to know what we were talking about, now stick around until it's over!"

Patrick was shocked by the force in Nate's grip, holding him still, inches away from the young growing bodies. The twin's eye line were now equal with his...and then above it! And the growth didn't appear to be stopping!
1131.title: Gifted Brothers

11312.content:
Inch by inch the twins grew taller, forcing Patrick to watch as they rose higher and higher above him. Their clothes, made for rather short twelve-year-old boys, now seemed ridiculous trying to cling on to their bodies, which were now bigger than most adults! The front of their shirts had both completely ripped open, revealing their smooth, flat chests and stomachs, still looking similar to how they had looked before, just a lot... larger! Their pants didn't seem to be doing much better, ripped to shreds below the knees and squeeze tightly around their crotches. It was obvious that the sensation of growing was very pleasurable to the two boys; their straining bulges proved it!

With one hand still firmly on Patrick's arm, Nate unclasped his hand from Nick's and brought it up to his chest. He began to slowly run down it with his fingers, closing his eyes and feeling his skin and brushing against his nipple. "Mmmm," he moaned, "this feels better than you could possibly imagine, Patrick! Too bad you'll never--" He stopped mid-sentence, whimpering slightly, then opened his eyes, frowning slightly. "Ah, dang it!"

Grinning, Nick took his arms and folded them over his chest. "You forgot that we have to stay touching to keep growing, didn't you?"

"Yeah..." Nate sighed, "but that's okay. It's not like we won't get a chance to do it again, right?" He let go of Patrick, the older teen quickly backing away to the wall, staring up at his brothers dumbfounded.

Nick only smiled in return, then turned his eyes down to see the results of what he and his brother had just done. Whistling, he nodded in approval. "Impressive."

"That's one word for it," Patrick muttered under his breath, the twins either not hearing him or ignoring him. They certainly were a sight to behold; both were just over seven and a half feet tall, their massive figures still pale and boyish in proportion. He wasn't even as tall as their shoulders, and he didn't like the sound of what Nate had said about "doing it again". What on earth could've caused this, he wondered-- and what could he possibly do about it now?

His thoughts were interrupted by the sound of a car door slamming in the driveway outside. Turning around and looking out the window, his heart sank as he saw both of his parents in their car, now backing out of the driveway. They weren't supposed to leave until tomorrow, he thought. Where the hell are they going?

As he spun back around to face the twins, Patrick noticed that they seemed to be eyeing each other a little suggestively. Nate was still feeling himself up, while Nick had brought his hand up behind his head, blushing while leaning back. He didn't like where this was going; they were his brothers, after all! But what could he do to stop these two adolescents who each had a good foot and a half on him?

Shaking his head, he waited until the twins each seemed to be completely distracted by each other, then quickly stepped around them and out of their bedroom. Neither of them did anything to stop him, too enamored with their bodies -- and with each other.

Patrick headed downstairs to the kitchen, hoping that his parents had left some clue or indication on why that had left tonight, instead of tomorrow like they had planned. Sure enough, there was a note on the kitchen table, but as Patrick sat down and started to read it, he could feel his stomach grow sick.

"Patrick," it read, "We've known this day would come for years, but it still is as hard to deal with now as it was when we first heard about it. As you've probably discovered by now, Nick and Nate are no ordinary 12-year-old boys. They're descended from a race of godlike beings who can manipulate their size and physical characteristics at will, once they've reached this age. These traits have laid dormant in the DNA of their predecessors for thousands of years, but the right combination of recessive genes are present in them to allow them to use this power once again. Our family took them in because we descended from the caretakers of this race, and they're genetically conditioned to listen to us and do what we say, at least most of the time. We're the only ones who can guide them and help them learn how to contain themselves, and keep them from becoming a destructive force to society. Your mother and I have done our best over these last twelve years, but once they come into full control of their power, they must imprint onto a new caretaker, which is you, Patrick. We wish we could've given you more guidance than this, but any hint of influence from us beyond these basic instructions would seriously jeopardize your ability to control the twins. We know that you're strong enough to do it, though, and though we can never see you or your brothers again, we'll always be watching over all of you. Love, Mom and Dad."

Letting the letter drop to the floor, Patrick slumped back in the chair, his head swimming with questions. Why would his parents never even hint at something like this before? How is any of this possible? And what the hell can he do to get the twins to listen to him if they're able to grow whenever they want? It all seemed like a strange and horrible nightmare, and he sat there staring, hoping that by realizing it was a dream he would wake up from it. But minutes passed, and nothing changed.

"Well," he said aloud finally, "if what this letter says is true, then I suppose I need to be back up their with the twins and make sure they're not doing anything too..." He didn't know quite how to finish that sentence. Still shaking a little from the shock, he rose to his feet and slowly made his way back to the staircase. Climbing up the stairs, he listened for the sounds of Nate and Nick doing-- well, the things that they looked like they were about to do when he left the room. But he heard nothing.

As he reached their bedroom door, which was closed, he placed his hand on the handle and took a deep breath. Opening the door, he was shocked to see--

113121.content:
Patrick was surprised to see both Nick and Nate, not only back to their normal sizes, but now tucked away quietly in bed, sleeping. The only evidence that anything extraordinary had happened were the bits of shredded cloth on the floor from their pajamas. He hesitated slightly before walking over to Nick's bed. He wasn't nearly as rambunctious and wild as Nate could get (though he could give him a run for his money when he got wound up) so Patrick felt a little more comfortable approaching him knowing that he could change himself so drastically...but then again that was only possible while they were touching...Patrick shook his head, feeling exhausted. This was all just...way too much for him to process right out of the blue! Maybe being confused was part of his "training" as a caretaker to these god like boys.

He gently shook Nick's bare shoulder, the younger boy groaning slightly before turning over onto his back, opening his eyes blearily. He grabbed his glasses and put them on, squinting at Patrick. "Patrick? What are you doing? It's past our bedtime..."

"I know it's just that...I got a note from Mom and Dad and..."

"Oh." Nick said, nodding, a bit of a sad, sympathetic look on his face. "Yeah...I thought I heard them leave."

"You knew this was going to happen?" Patrick asked, blinking slightly.

"Well...yeah! I mean, ever since we were little we knew what was going to happen. We really, REALLY wanted to tell you Patrick, HONEST, but Mom and Dad made us promise not to. They said if we told you, you wouldn't be able to take care of us as good."

"If you know more about this than I do though I'd really like to learn." Patrick said, sitting down on the bed next to Nick. "Should we wake Nate up?"

Nick looked over at his sleeping twin, a loud snore emanating from the other bed. "Nah...let him sleep. He's not as good at explaining things as I am anyway. Not too long though, okay? I don't want to be tired for school tomorrow..."

Patrick felt a shiver pass through his body at that thought. Two mischievous twins, who shared every class together and sat next to each other, with the ability to grow at will and no supervision? Things could SERIOUSLY get out of hand! "We'll talk about that more in the morning. It might be better to keep you guys out of school for now until we can set some ground rules."

Nick giggled and said, "Hey, you're already starting to sound like a caretaker! I knew you'd catch on fast."

"What exactly...IS a caretaker though?" Patrick asked, scratching his head. "What am I expected to do?"

"Uh...take care of us?" Nick said, like it was obvious. "To be honest, we don't really know all that much about it either. Mom and Dad told us when we were little about what was going to happen but they said they couldn't tell us much of anything at all. Apparently we're supposed to all learn together, all three of us. All I know for sure is that you were always going to be our caretaker so we had to be adopted while you were young, so we'd grow up together and get close."

"How long am I supposed to be your caretaker though?" Patrick asked, almost dreading the answer.

"Well...forever...I mean, one of our kind hasn't existed for thousands of years! You need to be there to help us!"

"F-Forever?!" Patrick shouted, Nate snuffling in his sleep at the sudden noise, turning over. "That's...insane! I can't...what about MY life?"

"Come on Pat...it's not going to be THAT bad is it?" Nick said, looking a little hurt at this negative reaction. "We all get along don't we?"

"Yeah, but....but...I never agreed to this! It's not fair! What if I didn't WANT to be your servant?"

"Caretaker...you're not going to be a SERVANT that's stupid!" Nick said, getting a little heated himself now. "You're gonna be the only one who can control us! If we didn't have you then...then...we could just do whatever we wanted and things would get nuts!"

Patrick took a few deep breaths, trying to calm down. He knew Nick was right but this whole situation had just become even more impossible. His academic and professional life wouldn't waver but his personal life was pretty much gone. Who would want to be with him if it meant babysitting an increasingly powerful set of god like twins? Into their adulthood? Wait...if they could change their physical characteristics would they ever necessarily age? The way their powers had been described (the phrase "god like" being employed) seemed to point to them being able to be as young or as old as they liked.

"What's going to happen if I'm gone?" Patrick asked.

"You're not going to LEAVE us are you?!" Nick shouted, starting to look incredibly upset.

"No! I mean...you know...I..." He didn't want to actually say the word, but Nick slowly understood.

"Oh...I...I don't know...we're going to have to learn all this stuff together." Nick said, tears shining slightly in his eyes. The enormity of this situation finally seemed to be weighing down on the young boy.

Patrick sighed and hugged his little brother, those thing arms wrapping tight around him. "Don't worry...we will. We're in this together now, better or worse, so...we'll make the most of it."

"Okay...can I go to bed now? I'm really tired..." Nick asked, yawning loudly, taking off his glasses again.

"Yeah, sure. I'm going to be downstairs for awhile. I need to think about some stuff." Patrick said.

"Okay. Night bro." Nick mumbled, already sleeping again.

Patrick slowly crept over to the door, closing it quietly behind him before making his way downstairs. He made a beeline for the kitchen and started making a pot of coffee. There was no way he was going to be getting sleep any time soon. "Might as well have something to do while I think..."

As the coffee percolated in the kitchen, a mug with sugar and cream already added to it sitting on the counter, Patrick sat down in the armchair in the living room and started to collect his thoughts about his new life.
113121.title: Night Chat

choices: "Yes, but I'm going to stay there with you."
"No, we're going to go somewhere else."
"Yes, but you have to promise me you'll behave."
1131212.content:
Patrick's eyes snapped open suddenly, and he was dismayed to see early morning sunlight pouring in through the blinds, while the smell of burnt coffee wafted in from the kitchen. "I guess I was wrong about not being able to fall asleep," he said as he smacked his lips. "I guess the twins really took-- The Twins!"

Realizing why he had planned on staying up in the first place, he quickly jumped to his feet and dashed to the stairs, taking them up two by two. "I hope they're ok--" he stopped as he saw Nick through the half-opened door open the door, sitting on the bed in his underwear and thankfully no different than when they had their discussion last night. "Thank god."

"Uh, mornin', bro," Nick said, a slight embarrassed look on his face. It was then that Patrick noticed Nick was holding out his arm, and as he opened the door the rest of the way, he let out a yelp of surprise as he saw just what-- or, who-- he was touching.

"Nate? I-is that you?!"

Before him stood a monolithic, huge beast of a person. As he was facing the opposite direction, the only hint that Patrick had that he was looking at his younger brother was the messy crop of red hair that was now pushing against the ceiling. The skin, too, was pale and smooth like Nate's, and fully nude, Patrick was embarrassed to realize.

Even more amazing, Nate's body was bulging with muscle all over. His legs were each as thick as telephone poles, and his shoulders were almost as wide as the bed he had previously been sleeping on. The arms bulged with biceps on top of biceps, and as Nate turned around, Patrick could count 8-- no 10-- 12 rows of abs beneath two cannonball-sized pecs. Holding hands with the still-small Nick made Nate look even more incredibly oversized.

"Oh, hey, Patty," Nate finally said, his voice still innocent and child-like but much louder than Patrick was used to. Nate's grin spread from cheek to cheek as he looked down on his older brother, and he dropped away his hand from Nick's. "Ah, geez, I did it again!"

Nick rolled his eyes. "I'm pretty sure you've done plenty for this morning anyways."

Patrick ran his hands through his thick, dark hair, letting out an exasperated sigh. "Yeah, geez, Nate, what have you--HOLY HELL WHAT'S THAT!!"

His finger instinctively pointed out towards the area in between Nate's legs, where a massive pillar of flesh jutted out at least three feet in front of him. Patrick's tan skin turned bright red as he realized he was looking at his little brother's cock, which was now just below eye level to him, and seemed to be rising slightly the more Patrick gawked at it. The shaft was as big around as Patrick's waist, and below it two bulging, gently swaying orbs hung down below Nate's knees.

Patrick was speechless. "Like what you see?" Nate beamed, his eyes narrowing suggestively.

After a few silent seconds, Patrick shook out of his stupor. "N-no, Nate, what the hell are you trying to do? You can't go around like that!"

"That's what I told him," Nick said, standing up and heading to the bathroom.

"C'mon, guys," Nate said as he leaned against the dresser, shoving it several inches without even noticing, "I was just having some fun. Look, I'll go back now."

Right before Patrick's eyes, Nate's body started to shrink. His muscle, height, and endowment all receded, almost as if someone had overfilled a giant parade balloon and was letting air out of it until it came back to normal size. Within thirty seconds, Nate was back to his normal four-and-a-half feet tall, though he was still naked and sporting a healthy hard-on.

Still a little bit shaken, Patrick averted his gaze and pointed to the bathroom, mustering up his best "caretaker" voice. "That's better. Now, go ahead and start taking your showers. SEPARATELY." As if on cue, he heard the shower head begin to run, as Nick had already started. "Actually, Nate, you can go ahead and use the downstairs shower."

"You mean mom and dad's??" Nate's eyes lit up. Their parents' bathroom was strictly off-limits.

"Yeah, they're... yeah, it's fine." Patrick was unsure how much Nate was aware of their current situation, so he decided to wait until breakfast to talk things over with both boys. Nate grabbed his towel from the bathroom and ran down stairs, not caring that he was still naked.

Patrick sniffed himself, realizing he probably needed his own shower too, but he'd have to wait until he could find a time when both boys were occupied and able to be left unsupervised for a few minutes. For now, it was breakfast time. "At least they left us with plenty of food."

Twenty minutes later, Nick and Nate sat on opposite sides of the breakfast table, both in matching pairs of black boxer-briefs and a white sleeveless undershirts, their hair both still damp from the showers. Patrick had made sure to remove all but the chairs at either end of the table, so as his brothers wouldn't be tempted to do anything until they could have a talk.

"Here you go, guys," he said as he slid two plates of scrambled eggs and bacon in front of them, and they began to chow down. Bringing over his own plate to the table, he slid a chair from behind the kitchen island (where he had hidden it) and joined them.

"So," he finally said after both boys had stopped to chew, "I talked with Nick a little last night. I suppose you both know what's going on?"

Nate turned to him, his mouth still half-full of scrambled eggs as he talked. "Yeah, we're-- it's just the three of us now, right?"

Nodding, Patrick took his fork and stuck it in his eggs, but didn't bring it to his mouth. "That means... I'm supposed to take care of you guys from here."

"Yup!" Nick said as he crunched on some bacon. "I'm sure you'll do great, bro!"

I wish I could be so sure, Patrick thought. "Thanks. But that means you guys are going to have to listen to me and do what I say from now on, got it?"

"What do you mean?" A goofy smile spread across Nate's face. "When have we ever not listened to you?"

"Like every day," Nick answered his twin, and they both giggled.

"Guys," Patrick interrupted, "I'm serious. I'll be honest with you: your... power, or whatever you want to call it? It scares me a little."

The smiles disappeared from both twins' faces. "Really?" they said in unison.

Gulping, the older brother nodded. "It does. I mean if it was up to me, I'd say don't use the power at all, just be safe. But something tells me that's not practical."

"Or fair," Nate said as he finished the last bite on his plate. "Why would we want to keep something so awesome locked up like that?"

"I know," Patrick agreed. "If I was your age and could do that, I'd want to use it all the time too. So, let's make a deal."

"A deal?" Nick repeated, his ears perking up.

"If you guys want to grow, or change, or do whatever, you'll ask me first, and listen if I say no. And, in return, I'll be open-minded about it and let you have fun when it's not going to hurt anybody or cause trouble. We can even find ways for you to really let loose, if you want."

Nate and Nick turned from Patrick to look at each other, tilting their heads as they considered the offer. Nate was the first to speak. "What do you think?"

"I mean, we kinda have to," Nick replied, pushing his glasses up his nose as he did. "He's our caretaker, after all. Besides, it sounds fair."

"I guess," Nate sighed, then turned back to Patrick. "Okay, deal."

Thank god, Patrick breathed a sigh of relief. "Awesome. Now, go upstairs and get dressed."

"You mean for school?" Nate asked.

Patrick thought for a moment. Was it really wise to send them to school on the first day like this? What other choice did he have? What about his own school? Finally, he replied...
1131212.title: Morning Surprise

choices: Hearing about Hercules, Nate asks Patrick to let them buff themselves a bit
Hearing about the Titans, Nick begs Patrick to let them grow bigger
Hearing about the gods, Nick and Nate take notes on what being a god means
11312121.content:
Nick and Nate both snorted into their plates as they heard Patrick's announcement. "Wait, wait, wait! Patty... you can't seriously be thinking of shadowing us at school all day?"

"Why not? I'm a caretaker, right? I need to keep an eye on you at all times, right?" Patrick insisted.

"Yeah but... what about your own school?" Nick asked quietly, remembering some of the previous nights conversation.

Patrick ruffled the boy's hair, smiling. "Hey, one day off school isn't going to kill my career. I just want to get a better idea of what your daily routine is so I can... you know... advise you how to handle yourself."

"You just want to make sure we don't cause any trouble." Nate said with a grin. "Look Patty, my boy, we already promised we'd be good little kids so why do you need to come along?"

"It's precisely because I know you two that I can't let you both loose without any supervision." Patrick said patiently. "Nick would be good but with you sitting next to him all day, whispering about things you could do, I can imagine it could get pretty out of hand."

Nate couldn't help but snicker, even as he felt a flash of annoyance. "Geez Patty... you know me better than I know myself! Okay, okay, okay, fine, fine, fine, you can come and we'll show you just what little angels we can be!"

Nick and Nate both grinned and held their hands together in a prayer formation, tilting their heads slightly and turning to face Patrick. The older brother grimaced and said, "Okay, that's enough of the creepy twin thing, please."

They all held their positions for a few seconds before bursting out into laughter, the tension and the weirdness of their situation broken for the moment as they just interacted like brothers. After finishing breakfast, both boys ran upstairs to get ready, Patrick moving at a slower pace. Rather than change into his school uniform, he put on casual, but presentable clothes: a polo shirt, dark jeans, and the pair of shoes between his ratty athletic sneakers and his dress shoes. Once he was ready, he knocked on the bedroom door of his brothers, calling out, "You two dressed yet?"

He heard them call out in the affirmative, opening the door, half expecting to see some odd spectacle again... only to see his brothers standing their, perfectly normal, and fully dressed. The middle school they attended also required uniforms so the boys were dressed in clean white shirts with a dark navy sweater vest over top, dress pants, and dress shoes. Nate tugged at his collar, grimacing slightly, looking like he'd rather be in far less while Nick smiled brightly, enjoying the outfit more than his brother. It was the common reaction both had to getting dressed for school, but Patrick was seeing every familiar interaction in an entirely new light. The older brother herded the younger out the door and into the car, adjusting the rear view mirror as the twins buckled themselves in, Nate's fingers already inching towards Nick's. "Don't think I don't see that Nate!"

Nate flinched, Nick looking over curiously, only to crack a smile as he realized what had been going on. He grabbed Nate's hand and held it up. "You know we can still touch each other WITHOUT changing ourselves, right?"

Nate let out a little moan as his trousers suddenly tented visibly, his body twisting slightly at the pleasure of the change, Nick hastily dropping his brother's hand. "Yeah, we sure can... but how can I resist?" Nate said with a cocky little smirk.

"That's strike one for you Nate." Patrick said sternly, turning around slightly. "Try that again and we'll march right back inside and you can spend the day in your room while Nick goes to school."

Nate rolled his eyes, but sat up straighter, nodding slightly. "Sorry... just got a little carried away."

Patrick nodded back and started the car, dialing his high school with his other hand. On the drive to the middle school, Patrick talked to the high school secretary, saying he needed to escort his brother's to their classes given a sudden medical emergency. He used the same line on the middle school secretary when they arrived, Nick and Nate dutifully backing him up. When they had managed to assure the secretary that, no, it wasn't anything contagious or dangerous, they were allowed to go to the first class of the day, history. The twins had two seats in the back, one right next to the other, and were close enough that they could reach out and touch each other if they wanted. Patrick was tempted to just park himself between them but that would have been ultimately counterproductive; they had to learn to get along without him constantly being there. Patrick tried not to notice the stares he was getting, the younger kids all curious why a high schooler was hanging out in their classroom. The teacher chose not to address it, starting class the minute the bell rang.

"Good morning class! Today I thought we'd start out talking about something a bit more fun than your typical history... Greek mythology!"

The class perked up a bit more upon hearing this. Since they had started European history, they had all been looking forward to this section. It was so much more fun to hear about monsters and heroes than it was learning about economic decline or depressing things like war or famine. Nick and Nate both eagerly listened as well, Patrick feeling a bit nervous in his seat in the back. He didn't want them getting any ideas...
11312121.title: Middle School Life as a High School Student

choices: At Lunch, they run into a bully who is just begging to be taken down a peg
In Gym class, they have to test their physical endurance and strength
In English, the teacher lets them write a brief story about anything they want
113121212.content:
"Of course, while the gods of Olympus are perhaps the best known of all the Greek mythological figures, they were actually preceded by a race of deities known as the Titans."

Patrick felt his heart sink a little more as the teacher started to lecture. This was certainly not the subject that he wanted the twins to be hearing today.

"These were the children of Gaia, Mother Earth, and Uranus, Father Sky. One of them, Cronus, gave birth to Zeus and led to the rise of the Olympian gods. They eventually fought the Olympians, ultimately losing and being imprisoned in the deep abyss known as Tartarus."

Judging by how they kept exchanging glances at each other, snickering, and then looking back at Patrick, Nick and Nate already had begun formulating some ideas based off of the lecture. Patrick dreaded hearing them after class.

"These beings were colassal in size, even bigger than the gods themselves, and could change their size at will. Perhaps you all have heard of the titan Atlas, who is often depicted holding the earth on his shoulders?..."

As the teacher went on, Patrick tried to guess just what Nate and Nick were planning, starting to daydream a little. The image of them stretching to the bedroom ceiling the night before came to mind, but it was only a start.

He imagined the two of them grasping each others hands and suddenly bursting through the ceilings of the school, stretching higher and higher above, their feet plowing through the walls and covering the rest of the campus, leaving him stuck below their toes. They became hundreds, if not thousands of feet tall, laughing maniacally as they stomped cars, people, and buildings beneath their heels. They would rampage separately for a few minutes, then hold hands again so that they could continue to loom higher and higher, able to destroy more and more with less and less effort, getting bigger and more powerful all the while...

Not the most pleasant of thoughts. Coming back to reality, Patrick hoped his brothers' typical good natures would prevent something like that from happening. But, as he thought back to the note his parents had left him, the phrase "keep them from becoming a destructive force to society" kept running through his mind. He began to realize that his own influence might be all that would keep the world from experiencing the kind of horror he had just imagined. It was an enormous weight on his shoulders, one worthy of Atlas himself.

As the class bell finally rang, Nick and Nate quickly gathered up their books and ran back to their older brother. "Hey Patrick," Nate said. "We have a question!"

Nick continued the thought. "Yeah, we want—"

"To grow yourself to be the size of titans?" Patrick looked at them disapprovingly.

"Well, maybe not that big," Nick rolled his eyes slightly. "But big enough that we can—"

"Have some fun!" Nate interjected.

"Yeah, and not just in our bedrooms either. Somewhere outdoors!"

Patrick took in a deep breath. "Okay," he finally said, "I can let you grow a little. But it'll have to wait until after school." The twins smiles faded slightly, but still shone with eagerness. "And," he added, thinking back to how his own parents would keep rewards for him until he fulfilled his responsibilities, "I want you to finish your homework first too."

Nate frowned, but Nick nodded. "We can do that," Nick said, elbowing his brother. "Right, Nate?"

"Yeah, sure," Nate mumbled. "It better be worth it, though!"

The next class was Math, which was both Patrick and Nate's least favorite subject, though Nick had always done okay with it. Throughout the class, the twins seemed even more fidgety than usual. They listened and took notes in class, but Patrick also saw them passing back and forth scraps of paper every so often, giggling as they did.

One fell to the ground, and after class Patrick picked it up and saw it was a doodle of two stick figures standing over a city skyline that didn't even come up to their knees. Below the drawing, in Nate's slightly sloppy handwriting, were the words "A good start?"

Gulping, Patrick crumpled up the piece of paper and threw it in the trash.

The rest of the morning was uneventful, Art and Science passing with no trouble at all. Patrick began to feel better about the situation. Hopefully, tomorrow, I won't have to come back here with them, and I can get back to my own life, he thought. Or as close to that as possible.
113121212.title: Weight of the World

choices: After school, Dylan and a bunch of his friends jump Patrick and the twins
School ends without incident and the three get ready to leave
Feeling disobedient, Nate keeps trying to sneak growth for the rest of the day
1131212121.content:
Luckily for Patrick, the next event of the day was an easy one: lunch. He had neglected to pack anything for himself but luckily the cafeteria workers were happy to allow him to take some food... so long as he paid for it like the other kids. The meal was a pretty standard one: rotini style noodles with meat sauce, a carton of milk, some bread, and a little cup of fruit. It was certainly enough for a middle school stomach but Patrick felt a little... unsatisfied by the offering.

He took a seat with his brothers, the twins whispering to each other and giggling, snatches of conversation drifting over to the other side of the table where Patrick was sitting. He picked up "titan" and "bigger than EVERYONE" and what sounded like "lift Patty up between my toes" before coughing loudly, interrupting them. "Remember you two... homework first, and no extremes."

Nate sighed loudly and slammed his forehead against the table dramatically. "Patty, you are being SUCH a killjoy right now! We're just TALKING about stuff, it's not like we're ACTUALLY going to do anything."

"Nate's right, you can't always treat us like we're planning something." Nick said, frowning slightly.

"You two ARE always planning something." Patrick dryly responded.

"Not ALWAYS!" they exclaimed in unison.

Before Patrick could respond, someone came up behind Nick, slamming him hard on the back, the boy's face registering shock before it was planted, messily, into his lunch, sauce splattering all over the table. "OOPS! Sorry about that freakshow!"

Patrick looked up in shock at the kid standing behind his brother. He looked like he was a year older, with dark brown hair slicked up into a faux hawk and the overall demeanor of a punk. His shirt was untucked, hanging out the bottom of his vest, his pants sagging down while his shoes were scuffed. He laughed obnoxiously before moving along, high-fiving a different boy, equally unkempt looking. Patrick turned his attention to his brother as he coughed, lifting his head back up, taking his glasses off and wiping them off with a napkin. "You okay Nicky?"

"No, I'm not." Nick said in a huff, looking deeply embarrassed, eyes focused fully on his food as he put his glasses back on.

"Who was that guy?" Patrick asked, turning to Nate.

"Dylan." Nate said with a grimace, rubbing his brother's back. "He's had it out for us since grade school. Singled us out because we're twins, I guess."

"Why does he call you freakshow?" Patrick asked, turning back to Nick. There wasn't anything outwardly freakish about the twins, outside of their... twinness.

"Because we're twins. It's THAT stupid!" Nick said, his voice rising slightly before he caught himself. "And because we do stuff like--"

"Finish each other's sentences." Nate picked up, shrugging. "I mean, some people also think it's weird when we talk at the same time."

Nick had joined in at the end, the sentence finished in unison, both boys shrugging this time. They looked so dejected and annoyed that Patrick couldn't help but feel a surge of anger at this Dylan. Glancing around, he leaned in close and said, "You know I said you guys couldn't grow until after school?"

"Yeah?" They both answered in hushed tones, leaning in.

"I'm willing to change my mind... provided you two are willing to teach a little lesson of your own."

The twins looked confused for a moment before Nick smiled, turning to look fully at Nate with his eyes glittering in delight. Nate continued to look confused, bordering on annoyed... until he, too, understood, a mischievous grin lighting up his features. They both turned to Patrick and winked. "You got it!"

Near the end of lunch, Dylan rose from his table to use the bathroom. Glancing around, he saw that his two favorite targets were nowhere to be seen, a cruel smirk spreading across his face. Maybe they were so upset they had run off. It wouldn't be the first time. Kicking open the bathroom door, Dylan made his way to the urinal, unzipping and slouching in front of it, practically posing for nobody who was watching... or so he thought. He heard the door open and close, glancing up into the mirror over the urinals, spotting his two favorite targets once again. He laughed rudely. "What the fuck do you two want?"

"Us?" They said together, looking at each other, before looking back at Dylan. "Not much!"

"You two really piss me off with your stupid freakshow bit." Dylan said, frowning, finishing his business and zipping up. "Maybe a few broken teeth will make you skip a beat."

"Careful Dylan!" Nick said, shaking his finger, his other hand gripping his brother's tightly. "Our big brother gave us permission to take care of you."

"HAH! You two? Take care of me? That's a laugh." Dylan said, cracking his knuckles.

"Actually... I think I'll give Nicky here the honor." Nate said, concentrating fully on his brother.

Dylan stopped his advancement as he saw something... strange happening. Nick's body appeared to swelling, his clothes becoming tighter on him. Upon closer inspection, Dylan saw the impossible happening: the little shit's muscles were GROWING! Inch by inch, more meat accumulated on those bones, his stick thin arms suddenly bursting with softball sized biceps, his flat chest pulsing forward, two slabs of beef pushing against his shirt, drawing it tight. His back broadened as his shoulders widened, the seams on his shirt beginning to pop. Down below, his thighs thickened visibly, his calves swelling in time with the rest of him, his shoes creaking as his feet became too much to be fully contained, the tops threatening to split open.

Dylan took a step back, stunned, as Nick not only grew more muscular... but taller too! His body slowly stretched upward, shirt coming untucked, peeks of the abs that had formed over his flat stomach becoming visible. He stopped before he truly threatened to burst out of his clothes, his previously shrimpy body now easily a few inches taller than Dylan... and far wider and stronger. Smiling, Nick released Nate's head, the now smaller twin folding his arms with a smirk as he watched his brother work. Dylan, freaked out, but not immobile, threw a punch at Nick's abs... only to feel his fingers crumple, bones shattering at the impact. Not only had the twins made Nick's muscles larger... but they had changed his very genetic makeup, making his muscles far harder than any human could hope to be. For Dylan, it was like punching, full force, a brick wall. Whimpering, the older bully fell back against the wall, clutching his hand to his chest. Nick reached out, grabbed a handful of the boy's shirt, and dragged him close. "You leave me and my brother alone from now on... or your hand isn't the only thing I'll be breaking!"

Nate covered his mouth to hide a snort of laughter at his brother's words; he sounded like the hero in a cartoon they had watched last week. Dylan began to blubber, shaking his head, promising he'd never so much as LOOK at either of them again if they just let him go. Nick nodded, satisfied, throwing him out the door, Patrick watching in amusement as the punished bully scampered down the hall to the nurse's office. Walking in, Patrick couldn't help but marvel as his hulking little brother, both boys celebrating and letting out whooping cheers. Nick, upon seeing his older brother, rushed forward and picked him up in a crushing bear hug, making sure to restrain himself enough to not hurt him. "Patrick that was SO COOL! I felt so... so good! I've never been able to stand up for myself like that! Thank you SO MUCH for letting us do this!"

Patrick chuckled, wincing slightly. "N-No problem! Can you maybe... put me down?"

"Oh, right!" Nick said, releasing his brother, looking a little awkward.

"Okay..." Patrick said, taking a deep breath, making sure there were no bruises. "Now that THAT'S over... time to go back to normal."

Nick sighed, crossing his arms. "I guess... I like being strong though... I bet I could hold the whole world up, just like Atlas!"

"Come on Nicky... we gotta listen to Pat, remember?" Nate said, clapping his hand on his brother's shoulder, the bigger twin already dwindling back down to normal size. Patrick was a bit surprised at Nate's acquiescence... until he noticed the boy's muscles subtly swelling. So while changing back one, the other could still change his own body at the same time.

"Hey Nate! Don't think I don't see that! Normal, right now, until after school and after your homework!" Patrick admonished.

"Gah! Fine! Dumb eagle eyed..." Nate muttered, his words becoming indistinguishable.

All three left the bathroom just as the bell ending lunch rang, heading towards the next class.
1131212121.title: Just a Little Bit

choices: They decide to play with some of the old equipment
They decide they want to get bigger, and fill up the room horizontally
They decide they want to go outside like this, much to Patrick's objections
11312121212.content:
The final two class periods of the day passed without incident. In English, the teacher droned on and on about some book Patrick had remembered hating when he was the twins' age, something about a house in New England that he found incredibly boring. He was surprised to see both boys stay awake throughout the period, scribbling down notes at an impressive pace, as he almost found himself nodding off himself at one point.

Gym class was at least more active, if not more exciting. The class played Dodgeball, and (through either a stroke of brilliance or sadism, Patrick wasn't sure which), the teacher had placed Nick and Nate on opposite teams, not even acknowledging their protests otherwise. Though he didn't say anything, Patrick silently thanked the teacher, as this was the class he was the most fearful of the twins using their powers during.

Nick and Nate were actually both fairly good at the game, and ended up being two of the last four players left. Their downfall ended up being that neither boy would aim for the other, so when the numbers started to dwindle, they both became easy targets. Nick was eliminated first, taking a glancing hit off his backside. Nate lasted a few minutes longer, almost able to catch a ball thrown at his chest, which just barely slipped through his fingers to the ground.

After the twins had showered and changed, Patrick met them at the locker room door. "Ready to go work on your homework?" he asked.

"That's the best part, Patty!" Nate beamed. "We're already done!"

"What?"

The two boys pulled out their notebooks and showed him pages full of equations. "We only had homework in math today," Nick explained, "and we actually finished it in English class!"

Patrick frowned, peering at the two notebooks. "Well, you guys really should pay attention in class... but you did finish."

"Right," Nate agreed, "so ready to honor our deal?"

Patrick nodded, though inwardly he began to fret. He had hoped he would be able to use the excuse of them taking too long with homework to weasel out of having to let them grow, but that option was gone now. It was too late to back out now.

As they walked out to the car, he mentally blocked out the twins' chattering, trying to think of what would be the best location to do this at. Sure, he had let them grow in the bathroom in front of Dylan, but that was only a small amount, and if the bully had told anyone he probably would be laughed off. From the sounds of things, Nate and Nick wouldn't be satisfied unless they could grow substantially bigger than that.

He had driven about a mile before he finally had an idea, and turned the car towards the southern edge of town. He had only been to that area once or twice in the last decade, but there was one place there that seemed to be ideal. As long as we don't get caught.

After a fifteen minute drive, they pulled into a large, empty parking lot in front of an old, abandoned brick building, three stories tall with large glass windows. Nate pressed his face up against the window, scrunching up his nose. "Where are we?"

"The old Zippy's factory," Patrick answered as he got out of the car. "They used to make dog and cat food here, before closing up about ten years ago and moving out of town. I remember this whole side of town used to smell like old rotting beef stew. It was gross." Even thinking of the memory now still triggered his gag reflex a little.

"Okay," Nick said, "then why are we here?"

"Because I'm honoring our deal. C'mon, let's go inside."

The two boys looked at each other excitedly, and both leapt out of the car and caught up with their older brother.

The door had been slightly rusted with age, but thankfully was unlocked, and opened with just a bit of effort. Inside, a short entrance hallway led to the factory floor. Most of the machinery that wasn't able to be sold had been left behind when the company had gone out of business, including two conveyor belts running on either side of the factory trailing from a pair of large metal vats that Patrick could swear still had the lingering smell of rotting pet food. All the lights inside were off, but the large windows let in plenty of light from the afternoon sun. Best of all, the ceilings of the factory were at least thirty feet overhead, and the room was at least as long as a football field and half as wide.

"Here we are," Patrick said. "Do whatever you guys want to in here— just as long as you don't cause any major damage," he quickly added.

"Oh boy!" Nate exclaimed excitedly, grabbing his twin's hand and dragging him towards the center of the room.

"Waitwaitwait," Nick protested, pulling free before Nate could start anything. "Aren't you forgetting something?"

"Am I?"

Nate gestured towards his body. "We don't want to ride home naked when we're done, do we?"

It took a second for Nate to pick up his brother's meaning. "Oh, right, our clothes. We don't want to ruin them, I guess. At least not this time," he added in a hushed tone.

Nick chuckled, and the two boys started to disrobe. Patrick started to protest, but realized Nick was right. He had almost ripped apart the school uniform in the bathroom earlier; with what they probably had in mind, the clothing would quickly be in tatters.

A minute later, Nick and Nate stood naked, while Patrick held onto their clothes to keep them from getting decades-old grime all over them. Smiling at each other, they each grasped each other's hand, and closed their eyes.

Without a word, their heads started to rise up. Patrick was nearly caught off guard by how quickly the boys were growing now, as if their previous efforts had just been for practice. Within seconds, they had surpassed him in height, and rapidly stretched towards the ceiling. Their feet slid across the concrete floor, each twin having to take a step apart every so often as their bodies got bigger.

"Mmmm," Nick said, closing his eyes. "This is the best so far."

"We're not done yet!" Nate replied.

Patrick watched in awe as their waistlines passed his head, then their knees. He stepped back and back until he was flat against the wall, not wanting to be accidentally found underfoot by his two behemoth brothers.

Finally, the twins' heads brushed against the ceiling, and they dropped their hands away from each other. Nick looked down at his surroundings, laughing a booming yet childish laugh. "This is so cool! Everything is so much smaller now!"

"Yeah," Nate agreed, scanning the floor for their older brother. "Hey, Patty, what's the matter? You're not scared of us, are you?" He flashed a devilish, toothy grin, that broke into a snickering laugh.

"N-no," Patrick stammered, trying to bring his instinctive trembling under control. "just... that was... impressive, I guess?" Despite not really believing that his brothers would hurt him, just seeing such powerful beings in front of him was a little intimidating.

"I bet." Nate turned to his twin, patting him on the shoulder. "Alright, Nick, what do you think we should do now?"
11312121212.title: Holding Up His End Of The Bargain
