I will never forgive you.
114112.content:
BEEEEP! BEEEEP! BEEEEP! BEEEEP!

Ray woke up with a start as his alarm clock went off. Before he had realized it, he had fallen asleep and it was already morning the next day. Instinctively his hand shot out to slam down on the snooze button, but he accidentally knocked it off his bed stand. Swearing he reached down to turn it off, but found that it had rolled under his bed, making him swear louder as he got out, got on his stomach, grab the clock and slam it off. His anger at his clock rekindled his anger towards Mike, making Ray feel crappy already.

Sitting on the floor by his bed, he contemplated what he wanted to do. a part of him wanted to try and go back to bed and hide there forever, but after the episode with the alarm clock he was no wide awake. Not only that, he was starting to become hungry, and there wasn't much stuff that was edible in his room. Despite his desire to sit and brood all day in his room until the end of time, he knew he had to get out and face reality: he was going to stay small, and his brother was only going to get bigger.

Ray groaned as he leaned back, his head bumping against his stand. Why did this have to happen? Ray was so close to achieving his goal. Perhaps it was a good thing that Mike drank the formula first, he tried to tell himself. Mike could be the first guinea pig, and Ray could observe the results...No, that was wrong. Ray couldn't fool himself, he had wanted to take that formula so badly, and the fact that his already gifted little brother received it made it even worse. And to top it off, it would take months to recreate the stimulant! And that wasn't including the time he needed to raise enough money to purchase the compounds and components, nor the fact that some of those components were very difficult to find. By Ray's calculation, he would be able to replicate that stimulant after at LEAST a year.

The more Ray thought about it, the angrier he became. It was unfair. Mike already had everything Ray ever wanted, and now he was going to get more of it! That anger just grew more and more as Ray got dressed and went downstairs to go into the kitchen. The idea of punching his brother grew in his mind with each step he took, and when he was outside of the kitchen door he was ready to jump on top of Mike in a full blown assault.

When he stepped into the kitchen, though, he found the table already set up for breakfast, with eggs, toast, bacon, everything. Seated at his usual spot was Mike, who jumped out of his chair as soon as Ray entered.

"Ray! You're, uh, you're out of your room." Mike said. Ray quickly checked out Mike, trying to see if there was anything different. However, Mike looked pretty much exactly the same as he did the previous day.

"Of course I am, did you think I was going to stay in there forever?" Ray said, a bit more harshly than he intended. But he liked it that way.

Mike flinched back. "Well...you locked me out and everything. I had to sleep in mom and dad's room last night..."

"That's not nearly enough payback for what you've done." Ray said, his hands tightening into fists.

Mike looked down. "I...I'm sorry, I didn't realize you'd get so upset over a little drink."

"Little drink? LITTLE DRINK!?" Ray barely stopped himself from jumping over the table and lunging at his brother. "You don't have ANY idea how long I waited for that 'little' drink, and you just gulped it down when you didn't even need it!"

Mike took a step back. "I'm sorry ok! I didn't know it was so important to you. Look, I'll buy you a whole case of it ok? I got some money saved up from Christmas and my Birthday and stuff, so...so please don't stay mad at me ok?"

Ray took a deep breath and said...
114112.title: Things look worse in the morning

choices: Milk does the body good
The growth spurt begins. First it's hands and feet.
1141121.content:
Ray glared, twenty different horrible things on the tip of his tongue, but before he could start yelling, he paused.

Mikey's eyes were shiny, like he was one shout away from crying. Ray saw a new bandage on his hand, not fully covering a small burn mark. Mikey was super clumsy in the kitchen, with the coordination and attention span of a big puppy. And between the tears, the breakfast, and the kid practically offering him everything he had to make up for drinking the formula, it'd be easier to kick a puppy than to yell at him.

Ray let his breath out in a sad sigh, hugged Mikey to his side, and ruffled his hair. He heard a sniffle, and was sure he just got snot on his shirt. Gross.

"Are you still mad?" Mikey asked, not really looking at anything for a second and trying to pretend he wasn't rubbing his eyes.

"No, Mikey, I'm not." Ray rolled his eyes. "Well, yes, I am, but not at you. People forget with you, I guess, but you're ten. Taking stuff without permission is just a thing you're going to do sometimes. It's not your fault you can see the top shelf in the freezer."

Mikey giggled a bit and tugged Ray over to the table.

"Well, I meant it; I'll help you get some more of that drink, even if it takes my whole stash of money. And, I made this breakfast for you!"

Ray grimaced a bit as he bit into his scrambled egg and felt shells crunch in his mouth. Bleh. Still, the brat meant well, and...if he was honest, he should have locked the formula up or something. Now, he was going to have to come clean about everything, and hope Mikey wasn't mad at him.

"I hate being small."

Ray paused, not sure why those words came out of his mouth. He'd meant to start talking science, but-

"You're not small!" Mikey exclaimed hurriedly, jabbing a (mostly) empty fork toward Ray for emphasis. "You're taller than I am."

"By like three inches." Ray muttered.

"That's 'cause I'm big." Mikey said firmly, now shaking the fork. "I'm not stupid, Ray; I can sit my chin on most of my classmate's heads. You're not small, you're normal."

The rest of breakfast passed a bit quietly; Ray'd practically admitted to his kid brother that he was jealous of him, and it looked a bit like Mikey was struggling with the concept. Ray decided explaining the formula could wait a until things calmed back down again. Though he didn't ignore that Mikey ate more than double what he did, and finished off the gallon jug of milk. (He thought that thing had been full yesterday, but it'd been at a quarter this morning. Still, a quart of milk was a lot to drink!)

Maybe it was to pay him back for all the out-door stuff they did yesterday, but Mikey seemed fine with just vegging on the couch together and playing video games. An hour in, Ray started to get a bit worried when he felt Mikey leaning into his side. Looking over, he saw Mikey blinking slowly, eyes muzzy, and a pained expression on his face.

"Mike?" He asked, worried, bringing a hand to his brother's head; a bit warm, but not hot.

"Dun' feel gud," Mikey mumbled, curling into Ray's side and shivering a bit.

"What's wrong, buddy?" Ray asked, getting up and laying him out on the couch.

"Hurt," Mikey moaned, trying to curl back up a bit. The shivering got worse.

"Where?" Ray asked, freaking out a bit. God, if Mikey said side, or chest-"

"Feet." Mikey mumbled, curling up and grabbing his toes.

Ray blinked, considering that. Well, not a vital organ then. Panic time over, for now.

"Cold..." Mikey definitely had a 'sick little kid' whine going on.

"One sec," Ray said and quickly rushed upstairs and back and dropped a bunch of blankets and pillows on him.

Ray grabbed a glass and some water from the kitchen and handed his brother a painkiller. Mikey swallowed it and sipped the water.

"Milk?" Mikey asked, settling back into the blankets.

Ray shook his head, worried. Mikey didn't get sick very often, he was a really healthy kid. And whatever this was had hit the poor kid like a truck. Well, this was definitely an older brother moment; weekend watching sick little brother. Awesome.

"Please?"

Ray signed, and nodded.

"I'll got get some at the store in a few minutes. Just try and sleep."

"....kay."

Ray watched as his normally hyper kid brother fell deeply asleep at eleven in the morning, shivering under the blankets. Still, he didn't seem to be getting worse, so if he was going to get supplies he needed to go now.

The trip to the market was done at legal-if-you-squint speed. Ray stocked up on pain meds, milk, a few other groceries, tissues, the works. Mikey seemed to perk up a bit when Ray got home, blinking away with a yawn and a mumble of discomfort.

"Thirsty?" Ray asked from the kitchen.

"...yeah."

Ray poured out a tall glass of milk and added an ice cube so it'd stay cold for long sipping. When he got to the living room, Mikey was sitting up with one leg crossed in his lap, rubbing his foot with a pinched face.

"You okay, bud?" Ray asked, passing Mikey the milk.

Mikey tilted the glass back and started gulping. Ray watched, bemused, as the kid drained the whole glass in eight long gulps before deciding he needed air again.

"My feet hurt." Mikey whined slightly, leaning back on the couch. "And my hands, and...." he yawned, "and I'm real tired."

"Well," Ray patted Mikey's shoulder, feeling a bit out of his depth. "Just...try and get some sleep, kay? You'll be better before you know it."

"More milk?"

Ray quirked an eyebrow at the kid.

"You sure, Mikey?"

"Mmm. Dunno, but I'm still real thirsty, and milk just sounds good."

Shrugging, Ray got the kid a refill, which was downed just as fast. Mikey passed back out after that, face still scrunched with discomfort.

Ray sat down at his little brother's side and turned on a movie. Feeling the kid wriggle a bit in his sleep, Ray scopped up his legs into his lap and started massaging Mikey's feet. He heard Mikey giggle a bit at the touch before he worked out how not to tickle, then the kid let out a relieved sigh.

Ray watched two movies before Mikey stirred again. The kid was not a quiet sleeper, snoring the whole time, and sometimes letting out a gurgle that Ray figured was him regretting downing a quart of milk in ten minutes (or half a gallon in two hours, or over a gallon in ten).

Squirmy too; the whole time Mikey tossed and turned, sometimes Ray felt the kid's joints pop as he rubbed Mikey's soles, but the always calmed back down after a minute or two of massage.

Mikey stayed awake long enough to eat a large lunch and dinner on the couch, whatever had him sick not hurting his appetite, but the rest of the time just slept. Ray left him to it in the evening, tossed the empty milk jug, and went upstairs to bed

As he drifted off to sleep, one thought kept Ray awake.

What if the formula made Mikey sick?
.
1141121.title: Being the Bigger Person

choices: Explain the formula to Mikey so he has an idea of what's to come
Buy some more food first. Mikey looks hungry again already.
11411212.content:
It was a bit of a rough night for Ray. Now that the formula was gone and the rage and feelings of despair had passed the intelligent teen was beset with horrible thoughts of the damage he might have done to his little brother. It was one thing to test chemicals on himself but Mikey had never agreed to such things; what if what he drank was hurting his insides, doing damage to his organs, harming his bones? Ray tossed and turned while in the other room Mikey slept like a log, arms and legs sprawled out, mouth wide open and snoring like a chainsaw.

The next morning Ray, having gotten almost no sleep, cracked his brother's bedroom door open slightly and peered inside. Mikey was still fast asleep, now on his front, hugging his pillow, a thin line of drool leaking onto it. Ray couldn't help but let out a little chuckle at the sight. Mikey could be a pain in the butt but that was natural for a kid, especially a little brother; it was just in their nature. He closed the door again and walked to the kitchen, pulling out a pan and grabbing some eggs from the fridge along with bacon and bread. He was in the middle of cooking breakfast when a loud crash came from upstairs. Ray's head jerked up at the ceiling and called out, "Mikey! You okay up there?"

"Yeeeeeeah I just tripped." The younger male's voice drifted down from above.

Ray hesitated, not wanting to burn the food but also wanting to check on his brother. Luckily Mikey was quick and was soon bounding down the stairs, running over to his brother and hugging him around the middle. "Morning Ray! Thanks for helping me out yesterday...you got any more milk?"

Ray ruffled Mikey's hair and said, "Kid, you drank a full gallon yesterday, do you really think you need more milk?"

Mikey stepped back and playfully flexed his arms. "Milk does a body good! Just like the commercial! Plus it tastes really good."

Ray shook his head and flipped the omelet he was making over. "I haven't had the chance to get back to the store so you'll have to make due with water. Or juice."

Mikey groaned and said, "Fiiiiiine, I guess orange juice is pretty good."

He opened the fridge and grabbed the jug, setting in on the table before taking a seat, unscrewing the cap, and drinking straight from the jug! His throat bobbed as he took one, two, three strong gulps, his flat stomach pushing out slightly at the sudden rapid influx of liquid. He let out a satisfied sigh as he set the jug down, pushing it aside slightly as he watched Ray cook. "Hey bro?"

"What's up?" Ray asked, taking plates from the cupboard.

"My hands and feet have been feeling really weird since I woke up. Is that normal?"

Mikey knew Ray was extremely smart and often deferred to him in cases like this. Ray froze for a second before carefully answering, "Kids your age often feel pain in their hands and feet and limbs and such when they're...growing. So if you're feeling a little sore it's perfectly normal."

But was it? Sure it was normal for kids to experience growing pains and Mikey was just about at that age but Ray had to factor in the chemicals. Was this natural or something more? Ray scooped the omelet onto Mikey's plate, accompanied it with some crispy bacon and a slice of toast, setting it before his brother before making up his own plate. When he sat down, Mikey had already finished scarfing down his food, holding his plate up for more, a pleading look in his eyes. Ray sighed and made more food for his ravenous brother, the kid eating double his normal portions once again. "I'm going to start running up a big grocery bill at this rate..." Ray muttered before saying in a louder voice "After breakfast I want to take a look at your hands and feet Mikey, okay?"

"Sure thing!" He replied before chugging more juice. Over half a jug, gone...

Once breakfast was over Mikey jumped to his feet, giggling as he saw his shirt was stretched slightly over a rounded belly. He patted it and poked it a bit, watching it vibrate slightly as the digestive process started kicking into high gear. "Woah, guess I ate a lot." Mikey said in a carefree voice. "I've been feeling really, REALLY hungry lately, guess I'm just--boooooooooooooaaaaaaaaaaaaarp!"

His words were cut off as a loud, long belch erupted from his wide open mouth, his hands pressing against his stomach as it shrank back down somewhat, the trapped air escaping from within him. He let out a few shorter blasts of air and sighed, rubbing his belly. "Oh, uh...excuse me..."

Ray patted his brother on the back and pushed him towards the living room. "Just go sit on the couch, I'm going to get some tools from downstairs."

"You got it bro!" Mikey said, jumping onto the couch and kicking his feet up, grabbing the remote. Ray didn't take long gathering up a tape measure, a stethoscope, a blood pressure cuff, and a reflex hammer. Mikey was only complaining about his hands and feet but it couldn't hurt to give him a bit of an overall exam, just to make sure there wasn't any health irregularities. Ray walked into the living room as Mikey let out a little huff of frustration, holding the remote up. "The buttons on this thing are really weird today! It's like they're in different places..."

Ray raised an eyebrow and grabbed the remote, looking it over. "No...it's the same as its always been. Are you feeling sick again?"

He reached out and pressed his palm against his brother's forehead, Mikey pulling back and shaking his head. "No, I'm not! Look!" He grabbed the remote again and started pushing buttons. "I'm trying to turn to channel 47 but I keep hitting five and one! Stupid..."

Ray watched his brother fiddle around, his thumb pressing multiple buttons at once, something that had never been an issue with Mikey before. Leave it to the kid to think the problem was with the remote and not his own hand. Ray firmly took it away from him again and crouched down at his side. "Okay Mikey I'm going to run a few tests. Just relax and do exactly as I say."

Bit by bit, Ray ran the usual tests on his brother. Heart rate...normal. Blood pressure...normal. Reflexes...normal. Mikey was starting to get restless, kicking his legs slightly. He had said his hands and feet felt weird so why was Ray going through all this extra stuff? Finally, Ray picked up Mikey's left foot, running his fingers along the sole, squeezing slightly in places. "Does that hurt?"

"No...kinda tickles though." Mikey said, wiggling his toes, joints audibly cracking.

Ray pulled out a length of the tape measure and held it up against the side of Mikey's foot, writing down the measurements before moving up to Mikey's hands. He repeated the process ("Does this hurt?" "Nope!") before measuring them as well. Taking a deep breath, Ray compared the measurements he just took to the ones he had taken last time he had done this for Mikey. His eyes widened slightly, Mikey noticing his brother's silence. "Is something wrong bro?"

"No...not wrong. Just...surprising. Stand up please."

Mikey did as he was told, stumbling slightly, his feet tripping over themselves a bit. Ray measured Mikey's height, noting that it was, thus far, unchanged. "Hmm..."

"Whaaaaaat?" Mikey whined, stomping a little a bit as he swung his arms around. "What's up? Why do my hands and feet feel so weird?"

"Here, I'll show you." Ray said, walking to the front door and picking up one of Mikey's shoes. He instructed his brother to sit back down and held the shoe up to his bare foot. Mikey's eyes widened as he saw his toes peeking out fully from the tip of the shoe.

"Wooooooah! My feet are bigger! Cool!" He giggled as he wiggled his toes, curling them over his shoe, the appendage itself also slightly wider than normal.

"This explains why you've been so clumsy this morning." Ray said. "Your hands and feet are a bit bigger than normal...which is, in itself, normal. Usually the hands and feet grow bigger before a...uh...growth spurt."

"So I'm gonna get a growth spurt? Sweet!" Mikey said, pumping his fist, jumping up to his feet. "Hold out your hand!" He ordered.

Ray held up his hand and Mikey pressed his palm against his older brother's, comparing them. Much to Ray's chagrin, the tips of his little brother's fingers reached beyond his own. Mikey squeezed the hand with a grin, threading their fingers, pulling his brother down into a sitting position. "Feet now!"

He stuck out his feet and urged Ray to do the same, pressing sole to sole. Mikey's toes were fully over Ray's, the digits able to comfortably curl over and grip the older male's. "My feet are bigger." Mikey said unnecessarily.

"Yup...sure are..." Ray said, resigning himself to whatever was to come. It wouldn't do any good to mope and whine so he was going to focus on dealing with whatever happened now. Even if Mikey was a brat he was his little brother and he had to look out for him.

But what to take care of first?
11411212.title: You Know What They Say About Big Hands

choices: Never food shop with a hyper kid mid growth spurt
Didn't Mikey's shorts cover his knees this morning?
114112122.content:
A tiny (hah) voice in Ray's head muttered that he was just putting things off, but he decided it wasn't quite time yet to tell Mikey about the formula. The kid was still adjusting to the new change; although watching him swing his arms and go up and down on tiptoes, Ray didn't think his brother minded.

With his longer feet came a bigger difference in height; Mikey grinned cheekily as he got toe-to-toe with Ray and slowly crept up past eye level, looking down at his older brother, before relaxing until his heels hit the carpet. On his second lift he looked up curiously and stretched his arm as high as he could, giggling even though his longer splayed-out fingers were still over half a foot away from touching the eight foot ceiling.

Ray shook his head at his brother's antics, prompting the brat to stick out his tongue.

"Alright, bigfoot, I think we should hit the mall for lunch, and do a bit of shopping."

"Cool!" Mikey exclaimed, dropping awkwardly to his heels with a bit of arm-waving. "Can we get some new games? Or...oh! We can go to the arcade!"

"I was thinking groceries, since you decided to eat the whole week's worth of breakfasts in two days. Also, maybe some shoes." Ray answered dryly, cocking an eyebrow down at his once-again shorter brother.

Mikey blushed a bit, and laughed, rubbing his neck.

"Heh, yeah, that makes sense, right? I mean, I can't even borrow yours, so mine have gotta be...." his eyes widened. "Oh no! My favorite sandals!"

Mikey was off like lightning, running at the stairs and scrambling up to his room with only one really loud crash. ("I'm okay!") When he came back down, he was walking even more awkwardly than usual and sporting some stupidly tiny footwear. Ray could see his toes touching the carpet over the fronts of those things.

"Yeah, that's not going to work." Ray commented, easily slipping on his own footwear.

"But it was the biggest size they had!" Mikey whined, glaring down at his feet with an almost betrayed expression.

Laughing a bit (maybe he were still a little peeved about the stolen formula), Ray ruffled his hair and corralled the kid into the car.

"Them's the breaks, Shaq junior," Ray snarked as he took off for the nearest mall. "Big feet, big shoes. And big shoes don't come with cartoon characters on 'em."

Mikey had a major pout going at that. But after a good minute, it seemed like a lightbulb clicked over his head. Glancing slyly to the side, he offered an evil grin and heaved a long fake sigh.

"I guess I can't wear these anymore." His teeth flashed. "So, do you want 'em? I mean, your teeny, little feet should fit in these just fine. So, do you want some hand-me-downs, little bro?"

There was a long, tense silence for a few miles.

"Truce?"

"Truce."

It turned out the brothers' first stop wasn't going to be a clothing store after all. After listening to gurgles and grumbles for the last few minutes, Ray made the executive decision to get his hobbit of a brother a second breakfast. So far, it looked like the kid was grabbing a large meal about every other hour, so he was definitely showing a "hollow leg." Ray couldn't tell for sure, but he thought Mikey's cheeks looked a tiny bit rounder, weirdly making the tall kid look a bit younger. Thinking back though, he thought he'd gone through a phase like that too when he was eleven or twelve.

When they got to the closest shoe store, Mikey was pushed onto a bench near the kid's section and told sternly not to fidget. So while he drummed out increasingly random beats with his fingers, Ray held his foot still and pressed it onto one of the free nearby measuring tools.

"Size...ten." Ray finally mumbled dully as he rose to his feet. Mikey bent over to peer at the lines and numbers as Ray walked past his own size eight section, skipped right past the nines, and grabbed a pair of slightly colorful sandals in a ten.

He came back to Mikey swinging his feet and humming something from The Grinch with a big smile on his face.

"Mikey...why are you humming a Dr Seuss Christmas song?" Ray asked has he plopped the much larger sandals down at his brother's feet.

Grinning, his little brother grabbed one of his old sandals and slipped it inside the new one, showing that his shoes from yesterday could 'wear' his new shoes. Then, he pulled the old sandal out and flipped it over, showing the barely-readable '6 1/2' etched into the sole.

"I checked that, and it made me think of it." Mikey offered mysteriously, slipping on his new sandals as he tried wearing an old one on his hand.

After the pair checked out, Ray turned them towards the local fresh market to pick up some food. Mikey strode alongside his older brother with less and less stumbling and more confidence. As the younger brother casually chucked his outgrown sandals into a nearby trash can, Ray heard him talk quietly to himself in a sing-song voice.

"What happened last night? Well around here they say, that Mikey's big feet grew three sizes that day."
.
114112122.title: Fun Times at the Mall

choices: Back home, after a big meal, Mikey's in the mood to play!
On the way home Mikey finishes the chips...and gets into the other groceries.
1141121221.content:
The brothers entered the market, the glass doors sliding open silently as a blast of cold air rushed out to meet them. The air conditioning always seemed to be running full blast in here which was a welcome relief in the summer time. Mikey sighed happily for a moment before taking off full force down one of the aisles.

"Mikey! Hey! Wait!" Ray shouted, rather uselessly as Mikey paid him as much mind as a mouse squeaking. Ray grabbed a cart and quickly wheeled it down the aisle Mikey disappeared down, catching a glimpse of him as he was already at the other end, turning the corner and disappearing once again. Ray quickly gave chase, turning the corner so fast he almost ran straight into his younger brother who was examining a stack of chips; luckily, Mikey was ready, hand outstretched to easily stop his older brother and the cart in their tracks.

"I want some of these!" Mikey said with that infectious grin of his, grabbing a bag of chips and tossing it into the cart. "Can I have more than one? Please? Pleeeeeeease?"

Ray bit his lower lip, thinking for a moment, before replying, "Sure, you can...two. Just two though! We'll just...consider this a special treat since Mom and Dad are away."

"Woohoo! Special treat!" Mikey shouted, tossing another bag into the cart before taking off again. "Special treat! Special treat! Special treat!"

Ray could hear the chanting no matter how far away Mikey got. He could feel his cheeks burning red as other patrons in the store gave him a curious look, eyebrows raised. Ray didn't say a word, turning the cart and following after his brother. "Mikey, can you please, PLEASE just stay by me and the cart while we're in here?"

Mikey answered by tossing a box of cookies into the cart. "Special treat!"

Ray shook his head and picked the cookies back up. "No, no, the CHIPS were a special treat, you're not getting cookies."

Mikey's stomach immediately rumbled loudly, as though the organ was aware of what it was missing out on and wasn't pleased in the slightest. Mikey rubbed his belly and turned those big puppy dog eyes on Ray. Despite how much his younger brother annoyed him, or even pissed him off, those eyes...they were like magic. Ray felt his will weakening as he threw up his hands. "Fine! Fine, you can have them. Let's just go crazy I guess! You can pick out...I'll give you...how about you can choose ten things you want as a treat? That sound fair?"

Mikey crossed his arms and thought about it, making Ray feel slightly nervous. Mikey was a good kid but suppose he refused? He was already pretty strong for his age and judging by his hands and feet, his body would catch up to their size at some point...though Ray wasn't one hundred percent sure how soon that would be. When he was bigger...would he even listen to his little big brother? Ray was shaken from these thoughts as his younger brother piped up, "Alright! Ten things! Does the stuff in the cart already count?"

"Yes." Ray said firmly. "So you can pick out seven more things you want. Just stick to the cart, got it?"

"Sure, sure." Mikey said nonchalantly, waving a hand as he grabbed onto the side of the cart.

The shopping trip was, at least for the moment, calm again. The two brothers went up and down each aisle, picking up essentials: bread, veggies, meat, fruit, everything locally grown and extremely fresh, perfect for a growing boy. Mikey was quiet for about ten seconds before he started whimpering when Ray only picked up a few things. "Bro, come on, get more than that. That's not going to be enough for me, even. Do you WANT to eat?"

Ray rolled his eyes and said, "Believe it or not, I'm not just a machine that feeds you. I do intend to eat."

"Then get more!" Mikey insisted, shaking the cart slightly. Ray was rattled; that shake was stronger than it should have been...

"Calm down, I'll get more then." Ray acquiesced. Two loaves of bread became four, one pound of sandwich meat became three, a liter of soda became two.

"These don't count as my special treats." Mikey was quick to point out, rubbing his mouth slightly as he began to drool at the prospect of all this food. Ray checked his watch. After the shoe store and by the time they were done shopping it would be time for another big meal. Unfortunately for Ray, while he was doing this, Mikey had taken off again, rushing back into view holding a gallon of ice cream in his hands. "You didn't say I couldn't get a big thing as a special treat!"

Ray sighed as Mikey tossed the tub into the cart. This kid was smarter than he looked. Strength, looks, smarts...did this kid miss out on ANYTHING in life? Ray gave in to fate for the moment and just let Mikey run wild, gathering up his "special treats", a phrase that was starting to grate on Ray's nerves for how often Mikey was using it. Ice cream, cookies, chips, candy, Pop Tarts, doughnuts, the kid gravitated towards junk food like a moth to flame. "Aren't you worried eating all this is going to make you fat?" Ray asked as they headed to the checkout aisle, the cart nearly overflowing with food.

"Nah, I don't get fat!" Mikey said casually, his arms behind his head. "I can eat whatever I want, whenever I want."

Ray clucked his tongue and said, "Well you're going to be eating good food before you can have any of this other crap, got it?"

"Suuuuuuuuure, sure, sure, litt--I mean...bro." Mikey grinned sheepishly as he remembered the truce.

Ray didn't notice the slip of the tongue. He was too busy focusing on Mikey's midsection, a small band of tummy visible between the waistband of Mikey's shorts and the hem of the shirt. Even when Mikey raised his arms up to the ceiling and stretched his shirt didn't ride up enough to show off skin....did it? Was this normal? Did Mikey grow again? Ray was so absorbed in thinking about this, Mikey had to shove the cart forward. "Bro, hey, wake up! It's our turn!"

Ray shook his head slightly, tossing things onto the conveyor belt mindlessly. He really had to stop treating every single instance of Mikey saying or doing anything as some kind of omen. He was making himself paranoid with all this. Ray ignored the looks the cashier gave him as he piled the food up, Mikey eyeing it all with hungry looks, his hand moving up to swipe away the drool from his lips every few minutes. "Hey, hey Ray, can I have some chips in the car on the way home? Pleeeeeeeease?"

"Just don't spoil your appetite." Ray admonished, handing his credit card over to the cashier. Well...his parents card that they were letting him use, anyway.

"I don't think ANYTHING can spoil my appetite, I'm so hungry." Mikey whined, his belly letting out another rumbling grumble.

"Kid, you are going to eat me out of house and home." Ray said, shaking his head.

That sly grin came back to Mikey's face. "Woah...that sounds kind of cool actually..."

Ray loaded the bags of groceries back into the cart and wheeled it all back to the car. Mikey immediately jumped into the back seat and grabbed a bag of chips, popping it open and greedily stuffing them into his face, crumbs falling down around him. Ray watched him for a moment before loading the bags into the back of the car. "This food is supposed to last us for at least a week, don't eat it all before then."

"Challenge accepted..." Mikey muttered to himself between munches.

"What?" Ray said, narrowing his eyes, not sure if he heard his brother correctly.

"Nothing!"
1141121221.title: Never Shop Hungry

choices: The Growth Spurt Continues: Arms and Legs
There are Sayings about Big Feet, Too
11411212211.content:
By the time Ray got the car parked, the crunching sounds had stopped. Ray was a bit relieved at that; sure he told Mikey he was allowed to snack, but the kid had just kept snacking and Ray had started to worry. Looking in the rear-view mirror, Ray saw Mikey had set the chip bag aside and was licking salt and crumbs off of his hands. He snorted a bit as he opened the door.

"There, you had your snack. Now close the bag and put the rest away while I get the trunk open."

"The rest?" Mikey tilted his head to the side and gave the bag next to him a quiet shake.

Ray blinked, then snatched the bag to peer inside.

"This was an extra-large family sized bag."

Mikey grinned and nodded.

"It was supposed to be a snack for the week."

Mikey laughed sheepishly and shrugged.

"I told you I was hungry,"

Ray sighed as he balled up the bag and trashed it, motioning Mikey to come around behind the car. Popping the trunk, Ray counted out all the bags and checked for spills; if the human vaccuum was going to eat all of it, he might as well carry it inside!

"It's fine, kiddo," Ray said, pulling out a few bags. "I'm not hungry yet anyway, so we'll have lunch-"

Grumble

"...now." Ray finished, passing bags to his brother with an incredulous expression.

"Seriously, Mikey?"

Mikey just took the bags from both of Ray's hands and grabbed them all up in one of his. His knuckles popped quietly as he made a fist, but his arm didn't drop from the weight at all. He gave the bags a few slow lifts, and grinned.

"What can I say?" He held his other hand out wide for more bags. "I'm a growing boy."

Ray quietly grumbled a bit about stupid over-grown kids as he passed more and more bags into his brother's waiting hands. Mikey just kept grinning and refused to go inside until he was carrying so many bags that Ray not only wouldn't, but couldn't have tried it. At that point the brat slowly staggered (he really pushed it) inside. Ray grabbed the two small bags Mikey left for him to carry, closed the trunk, and headed inside.

Mikey was moving from one side of the kitchen to the other, putting things away as fast as he could. He stood on tiptoes in the pantry, pushing an extra-large box of potato flakes onto the highest shelf, shooting Ray a grin as he cheerfully ignored the folded stool.

"Hey!" He grinned. "How about we have some pizzas? You do the oven stuff, and I'll put everything away!"

Well, that sounded a bit more like a demand than a suggestion, but Ray didn't really care what they ate, and Mikey was under no circumstances to use the oven, so whatever. Ray walked over to the oven and found a stack of frozen pizzas left on top.

"Which one you want?"

"Just cook 'em all!" Mikey called out from inside a cupboard. "We can play video games and snack for a while!"

Ray wasn't sure all of the pizza would fit in the oven at once, but that did sound like the easiest solution. Besides, he didn't want to be stuck in the kitchen cooking all afternoon for the kid. The quick kid, Ray amended, since by the time he'd unwrapped and started the pizzas, the food was almost all put away. Mikey was learning really fast how to best use those new flippers of his.

Ray set the timer, nodded, and turned to find Mikey holding the last of the groceries, a gallon milk jug, with a frown.

"It won't fit," Mikey offered as an explanation. "The fridge is stuffed."

"Well, yeah." Ray answered, pulling the door and double-checking. (Smart yes, but organized Mikey was not.) Nope, fridge really was full.

Mikey looked at the fridge, at his brother, decided the milk really wasn't going in that fridge, shrugged, pulled off the cap, and drank down five long gulps straight from the jug. Seeing Ray's slightly freaked-out look, Mikey shrugged.

"What? It's not going in there, I'm still hungry, milk is awesome, and I can just drink it while we play."

Ray didn't have an answer for that, so the two brothers headed into the living room, the (slightly) shorter one holding a gallon jug a bit like it was an over-sized coffee cup.

Booting up their game system, Ray tossed a controller at his little brother, smirking as he fumbled it a bit. What followed was a massacre of epic proportions; Mikey could not hit the buttons right. For the next few hours, the two brothers just hung out, snagging pizzas and playing video games. Ray couldn't help grinning as he watched Mikey glare a bit at the screen, his tongue poking out in concentration, and his fingers flailing around the buttons. Sometimes Mikey would take a break, getting up to rub his legs and arms and walk around the room.

In the end, Ray had maybe half a pizza. Mikey destroyed the rest, along with the milk jug. At one point Ray could actually hear a sloshing, gurgling sound as the kid paced in front of the couch. Mikey huffed a bit in frustration.

Ray felt kind of bad; it was almost like taking advantage of the poor kid to play video games when he wasn't used to his own fingers. Setting the controller aside, he gave his brother a poke, startling a laugh out of him.

"Wanna do something else?"

Mikey nodded, eyes lighting up as he slid down next to the coffee table and propped up an arm.

Ray groaned. "Something other than that?"

"Oh come on, Ray!" his younger brother whined. "You asked me!"

Ray grumbled a bit, but hunkered down and let Mikey wrap his fingers around the outside of his own hand. After an intense stare-off, both brothers began pushing hard against the other, their joined fist swinging back and forth. Slowly, their hands started moving toward's Mikey's side of the table. Mikey's eyes widened, and a surprisingly large bicep popped out as he made a big sudden push, forcing Ray on the defensive. Ray kept their arms even for a long time; even if he'd had a super disappointing puberty so far, Ray had still had one, and his arm was about as thick as Mikey's. In the end though, the difference was that Ray's arm was thick, but Mikey's was muscular. After a long struggle, Ray felt his smaller hand get crushed against the tabletop.

Mikey grinned at his brother with a hint of pride as he got back up. Ray frowned as he saw his little brother wince and massage his arms.

"You okay, Mikey?" Ray asked.

"Hmm." Mikey answered vaguely, rubbing along his legs. "Maybe I sat too much, I think I'm getting a cramp. And, well, it's weird, ya'know? I mean, it's cool, but my hands and feet got really, really big. Maybe it's all the milk? Like, how it 'does a body good?"

Mikey giggled a bit. "What if all those dumb sayings were true, right? Like, eating veggies really made you big and strong, or...or....a pinch to grow an inch, and stuff."

Mikey reached over and pinched Ray's arm, laughing. Ray winced, that had hurt!

"Cut it out." Ray gave his brother a light shove. Mikey pinwheeled his arms and fell back onto the couch, but he just grinned.

"But it's true!" Mikey insisted. "It's like...It's like something was pinching my hands and my feet yesterday, and then they really did grow an inch! And now, it feels like I've got pinching all over in my legs and in my arms, which kinda hurts, but what if it's the same? And all the milk I'm drinking, and - "

Mikey's eyes shot open and he jumped off the couch, bare feet slapping onto the floor as he tore off to the kitchen.

"I gotta eat more vegetables!"

Ray stared after his brother, only one thought on his mind as he put away the game system.

"How can you still eat?"
.
11411212211.title: Filling Up Some Hollow Legs

choices: Mikey's not used to his body and loses.
Mikey's superior size wins out!
114112122111.content:
Ray, somewhat bemused, watched Mikey rush into the kitchen, following along behind him as his younger brother opened the fridge and grabbed a bunch of vegetables; carrots and celery specifically. He carried the armload over to the table and dropped it there, sitting down and picking a carrot up. He sniffed it before gingerly nibbling the very tip of it. He pulled a face and muttered, "Gross...but if it helps..."

He bit into it with gusto, chewing the carrot up and swallowing it before taking another big bite, his other hand reaching to grab a stalk of celery which he also began to munch on, one after the other. Ray watched for a bit before sitting down opposite Mikey, the kid swallowing a particularly big mouthful of vegetable before asking, "Hey you think if I eat more meat I'll get stronger, too? That's what makes muscles bigger, right? Exercise and...uh...protein! Yeah?"

"Ye...n....I don't know." Ray admitted. It was entirely possible that Mikey eating and drinking all of these things was having some kind of effect on his growth. After all, the drink Ray developed had been meant to specifically stimulate the pituitary gland which promoted natural and healthy growth. Was the formula having an effect on other aspects of Mikey's body? He would never know for sure without an in depth study and that wasn't exactly forthcoming...until he told Mikey about what the drink actually was and what it was doing to him. Ray wasn't quite ready to take that step though; at least not yet.

"Well can't hurt to try!" Mikey laughed, chowing down on the vegetables again. The pile began to dwindle, bit by bit, until almost all the celery and carrots had been eaten, Mikey letting out a resounding burp before patting his stomach in satisfaction. "You know...those actually started to taste good after awhile."

Ray shook his head slightly and said, "Weeeeell probably because your tastes are changing a bit from when you were younger. You still almost wiped out half a weeks worth of veggies though."

Ray got to his feet and started picking up the leftover vegetables, putting them back in the fridge before scooping up the discarded ends that Mikey hadn't eaten and tossing them in the garbage. Mikey watched all this through half closed eyes, his arms and legs feeling oddly heavy while his stomach churned away at all the pizza, milk, and vegetables he had just consumed. He winced slightly and stretched his legs out, joints cracking slightly as he did so. He wiggled his toes, clenching them as well, each joint popping like a series of firecrackers, getting Ray's attention. He watched closely as Mikey stretched his legs out...and out...and out some more! His eyes widened as he saw his little brother's legs seem to catch up to his feet, moving one kitchen tile over...then two...and then a third! Mikey chuckled slightly, eyes closed, loving how GOOD it felt to just streeeeetch out. He lifted his arms up over his head and stretched up, fingers cracking, elbows popping, the limbs lengthening before Ray's astonished eyes. There was no denying it now; Mikey was definitely GROWING, though the pace seemed...erratic. His hands and feet had grown larger first, overnight, and his arms and legs were now only just catching up...though it hadn't taken a full day like with Mikey's hands and feet. Was the process slowly escalating or was this what was going to always happen? Feet, then limbs...and then presumably torso and head? There were far, far too many unanswered questions and Ray was working against all his experiments, which had been performed on animals post puberty and never on one before or during.

As Ray pondered, Mikey finished his stretch with a loud yawn, letting his arms flop back down on the table with an attention drawing BANG! Ray jumped slightly and Mikey snickered, rubbing his eyes. "Spooked ya bro?"

"Just a little..." Ray admitted, wondering how aware his tired brother was of his transformation. "You...feeling tired Mikey? Want to go to bed?"

"Mmmm, not sure..." Mikey admitted, scratching his cheek and standing up...and up...and up! Ray's eyes followed Mikey's face as it started out below him....met his gaze...then surpassed it! Ray's jaw dropped open as he realized his worst nightmare had come true.

His little brother was TALLER than him.

It wasn't by a huge margin; Mikey was just a head taller and Ray was already short for his age to begin with but still...the balance had shifted once and for all. Ray's eyes traveled up and down his brother's body, taking it all in. His shirt, oddly enough still fit rather well beyond the slight broadening of his shoulders, the sleeves now far too short for Mikey's lengthened limbs. His shorts were similarly problematic, the hems, which had once covered his knees, now wrapped more tightly around his thighs. Overall he had a more lanky build now, his tight, fit body lost for now in a more stretched out look. It wasn't unnatural looking, he just had more the look of a basketball player now rather than a football player...for now. Everything was bound to catch up soon after this most recent spurt...or was this all one very long, ongoing spurt? Ray was getting frustrated by how many questions he had to keep asking himself, his eyes rising to meet Mikey's...who was looking down at him with wide eyes.

"M-Mikey...now hold on a second...don't get TOO excited!" Ray warned, backing away slightly as Mikey leaped into the air, hollering with joy.

"Holy moley! Look at me! I'm big! I'm really big! It worked, it really did!" Mikey cheered, flexing his arms, bending his legs, gazing proudly around the kitchen, marveling at how everything seemed smaller and lower to him now. He grinned at Ray and said, "Now I guess you really ARE my little bro, little bro!"

"Hey, I thought we had a truce..." Ray said weakly.

"Yeah, but that was before!" Mikey said firmly, nodding. "Back when you really were bigger and it was just a joke, me calling you that. But it's not a joke anymore! Now you are the littler brother! So I'm going to call you little bro! And you...you can call me...big bro! Okay?"

Ray did not like how excited Mikey was by this prospect, his chest heaving as he breathed more rapidly. "I...don't think so. I'm still your older brother and...I'm not going to call you big bro!"

"Oh yeah? Wanna bet?" Mikey asked smugly, puffing his chest out and standing up a little taller, looking down at his brother. "How about we play a game for it? If I win, I'll call you little bro and you'll call me big bro. And if you win, I'll still call you big bro and you can still call me little bro, okay?"

Ray knew this tone, this posture. Mikey was testing his boundaries. If Ray gave in and played and lost he would no doubt lose a lot of authority in Mikey's eyes. If he backed down, however, Mikey would still consider it his loss, calling him afraid. The only winning move was for Ray to except and actually beat his brother. "Alright...fine. What game?"

Mikey grabbed Ray's hand and dragged him into the living room, pushing aside the couch and love seat with a grunt, kicking the coffee table down the length of the room to clear a space in the center of the carpet. He grabbed a few couch pillows and tossed them haphazardly around in a circle before squatting down at one end of it. "Wrestling! First to get pinned for three seconds or get knocked out of bounds loses!"

Ray sighed, already regretting this decision, and took his place opposite Mikey. "On the count of three then..." He said.

"One..." Mikey started, a grin already curling the edges of his lips.

"Two..." Ray said, gulping nervously.

"THREE!" Both brothers shouted, charging forward and locking their arms around each other.
114112122111.title: Stretching Out and Up

choices: Mikey runs into some friends at the park
Ray runs into some "friends" at the park
1141121221111.content:
Ray figured out really fast that he was not winning a contest of strength with his lit...younger brother. Mikey had always been strong for his age, and even if he looked a bit gangly right now that muscle was still there. As Ray wrapped his arms around Mikey's middle and pressed his shoulder into the big kid's chest, Mikey just laughed as his feet skidded back a few inches. Before Ray really knew what was happening Mikey had wrapped his hands around the older boy's waist and picked him up off of the floor! The room spun around as Mikey flipped Ray over and slammed his back into the carpet.

The only thing that saved Ray from a fast and humiliating defeat was that instead of pressing his advantage Mikey released his grip and raised up a leg to try and step on his older brother's chest. Ray gulped and rolled quickly to the side as Mikey let out a playful roar and brought his big foot down with a loud thump. He couldn't help feeling relieved as he saw his brother clearly fooling around and not seriously trying to hurt him; Mikey might be pushing his boundaries but at least he was still just a kid who wanted to play. As Mikey wobbled a bit on his longer legs, Ray got an idea.

Holding his arms in tight, Ray continued his roll along the ground, careful to keep an eye on his brother looming above him and at the pillows he was just about to reach. Mikey, laughing at how easy it was to shove his older brother around now, continued taking big exaggerated stomps as he chased after his smaller older sibling.

At the last moment, on the very edge of the ring, Ray struck. He knew he'd only get one shot. As his brother took another awkward, exaggerated Godzilla stomp, Ray spun, kicking at Mikey's only grounded leg and threw his arm up as high as he could. Mikey's eyes widened in surprise as he was put badly out of balance. His mind would need time to adjust to his longer limbs, and per Ray's plan, his much higher center of mass. Add to that the brat had been hamming it up and had thrown his big foot forward to stomp his older brother, and Mikey began to tip toward the pillows. Ray's outstretched hand could barely hit his taller brother in the back as he tipped, but that little bit of extra push sent his younger sibling tumbling out of the ring in an awkward tangle of long limbs.

"Oof!" Mikey gasped as he rolled to a stop and started working out where his hands and feet where. Pouting, the younger brother scrambled to his feet and crossed his arms.

"I want a rematch!"

Um....no.

"No way Mikey," Ray answered, getting up quickly so Mikey wasn't looking down on him as much. He puffed up as much as he could and dropped his voice; a trick his younger brother couldn't pull yet, and tried to put authority into his tone.

"I played the game with you like you wanted; you made the rules. Or are you going to punk out like a little kid?"

Mikey frowned for a second, but after a moment he gave a toothy grin and laughed. He quickstepped over to his older brother and picked him up again, though this time in a tight hug. Ray had mixed feelings.

"Okay, okay. Sorry I was being a jerk. And wow! I didn't think you'd win, being so little and all!" Mikey looked at his brother with admiration.

"What happened to me being normal and you being big?" Ray asked, raising an eyebrow.

Mikey set his brother down quickly and waved his hands, eyes wide.

"Yeah, yeah. I didn't mean you were little, um, it's just that everything looks littler now, and, I mean -"

"It's fine, brat," Ray sighed. "And I wouldn't have beaten you if I didn't know some stuff about dealing with bigger guys, so it's...sort of fair to say it like that."

Mikey narrowed his eyes.

"Whadda you mean? Do other kids try to stomp on you?" Mikey actually growled a little at the end.

Ray quickly shook his head and started picking up the pillows.

"It's fine Mikey, really. Just some arguments, school crap."

Mikey still looked upset as he easily slid the furniture back into place. Ray searched for a distraction.

"Hey, Mikey, how about we go the the park before it gets dark. We can shoot hoops or something."

Mikey paused, before grinning again and eyeing the ceiling. A few seconds later, the goof was giggling as he flexed on his tiptoes, his hands splayed wide, and flat, along the ceiling. Dropping to his heels, Mikey gave Ray a cheeky grin before rushing off to get his sandals.

"Sounds like fun, 'big bro." Okay, sure the jerk said it, but Ray could hear those air quotes. "Let me know if you want a piggy-back ride!"

Ray scowled a bit as he slipped on his shoes and his brother tried to ruffle his hair. Locking up, he very much did not respond to the offer of a piggy back ride; he merely trailed along, letting his younger brother get used to his longer stride, making the brat double back if he got too far ahead.

At least the punk was listening for now. Though Ray didn't know how long that would last. After all, he'd seen how fast the kid just grew, and he had a bad feeling Mikey wasn't finished yet. After all, while his limbs had stretched out, Ray knew how growth spurts worked and the kid's torso hadn't caught up yet.

And as Ray had bent down to tie his shoes, he'd seen Mikeys' toes poking out the front of his new sandals.
.
1141121221111.title: A Matter of Leverage

choices: Ray takes it well, maybe having a big little brother isn't ALL bad.
Ray does not take it well; now he'll be even more of a laughingstock at school.
11411212211112.content:
The park was relatively close to the boy's house; it was a location they had often frequented growing up, playing on the playground when they were really young and moving up to the basketball court as they got older. Mikey had fond memories of playing with his bro there but they were tempered with memories of sadness when Ray suddenly...stopped coming to the park to play with him. He didn't understand why it happened, how Ray had felt increasingly inferior, how Mikey's jabs dug a little too deep for him sometimes, how the cruel taunts at school played with his mind. It was all a bit too complicated for a kid but now, now Ray was actually coming to PLAY with him again! He wasn't going to let anyone or anything get in the way of them having fun.

Mikey was practically vibrating with energy as excitement as he moved forward, then doubled back, then moved forward again, then looped back around Ray. It was like walking with an energetic puppy in human form. Once the park was in sight Mikey broke out in a full sprint, heading straight for the basketball court which was, thankfully, empty. Ray walked at a more leisurely pace, scanning the park. The whole thing was pretty much empty, save for a scattering of little kids playing around on the slide. Ray watched as they moved from slide to teeter totter to swings, smiling slightly as he remembered Mikey and him playing in the same way. "If only things had stayed that way." Ray mumbled to himself, heading over to the court. But why hadn't it stayed that way? What had happened? The more Ray thought about it the more uncomfortably he realized that, well, he had just...stopped playing with Mikey. And why? Because he grew? How was THAT fair? Ray shook his head slightly and pushed the thoughts from his mind. "Worry about that later just...lets focus on getting through this."

The park, in order to encourage more visitors to come by, had various sports equipment that could be checked out for free from a little shed on the premises. By the time Ray got to the court Mikey had already gotten a basketball and was dribbling it. He jumped up slightly and shot the ball, the orange sphere moving in a perfect arc before cleanly entering the hoop. "So, what do you wanna play?" Mikey asked with a grin, chasing after the ball.

"Horse?" Ray asked meekly, feeling a bit intimidated by how fast and fierce Mikey was moving.

"Awwww, that's not much fun though. Let's play one on one! Come on, please? Just a few rounds? Until ten baskets?" Mikey pleaded, pouting out that lower lip. Mikey may have been big but he wasn't afraid to turn those big old eyes onto his brother if it got him what he wanted.

"Fine, fine." Ray acquiesced, feeling increasingly uncomfortable. It was one thing to possibly lose against Mikey in private but in public? He looked around once more, making absolutely sure nobody was around before holding his hands out. "Check it."

Mikey beamed as he bounced the ball towards Ray, the older brother bouncing it right back. The second the ball touched Mikey's hands he was off like lightning, dribbling and moving around the court with reckless zeal. Ray shadowed his brother as best he could, holding his arms out, managing to keep up with Mikey's movements due to their clumsiness; the kid still hadn't quite gotten used to his longer limbs but he was a fast learner. Ray was able to keep up for a few minutes before Mikey pivoted and jumped, tipping the ball into the basket. "Yes! One for me!"

Ray grabbed the ball and said, "Don't get too cocky, that's just one point! You got nine more to go!"

He checked the ball and dashed to the left, stopping short on his foot before pushing in the opposite direction, moving his arms to try and goad Mikey with a feint. Mikey, trying to move in two directions at once, ended up twisting his legs around each other, his feet stumbling, sending him to the ground. "Ouch! Hey! No pushing!"

Ray, with a bit of effort, managed to make a basket. "Not my fault you can't control that big body of yours yet."

Mikey scrambled to his feet and said, "Enjoy that point cause it's gonna be your last!"

His words were hammy and exaggerated and he followed up this declaration with a hearty "Ha, ha, ha!" Ray couldn't help but smile at his goofy brother as they squared off again. Back and forth, the brothers were evenly matched for the first five points but the more they played, the more Mikey's athletic prowess, physique, and growing control over his own body started to edge out Ray. By the end of the hour they were 6-9, Mikey's favor. Ray panted as he bent over, his hands on his knees, his shirt soaked with sweat. Mikey, who was also sweating, was upright, the ball tucked under his arm, pratically glowing with vitality as he grinned. "You doing okay big bro? We're at the end here! Game point! Think you can stop me?"

His tone was still playful but Ray couldn't help but feel those old resentments bubbling up again. "Whatever...lets just get this over with..."

Mikey's grin faltered slightly, transferring the ball to his hands. "Sure...don't give up now! You can still win!"

Ray's hand were shaking slightly as checked the ball, Mikey pressing hard to the basket. Ray planted his feet, trying to block his brother but his tiredness mixed with Mikey's energy finally collided in a bad way. Mikey barreled right through Ray, knocking him to the ground, winding him as Mikey jumped for the basket and actually managed to dunk it. "Woohoo! Did you see that, bro?! I dunked it! I can't believe it! That was SO COOL!"

Ray gasped a little and sat up, holding his stomach. "Yeah...great..."

"Did I hurt you?" Mikey asked, bending down and holding his hand out to help his brother up. "I'm sorry I just got so excited and....did you see it? Did you?"

"We ALL saw it, kid."

Ray groaned as he slowly got to his feet, pushing Mikey's hand away. How could this situation possibly get any worse? Ray saw a trio of teens his age step onto the court. "How long have you been standing there?"

"Most of the game, shorty." The boy in the middle said, grinning. How different of a grin it was from Mikey's, filled with amused cruelty. "So it's true, you're not just a pathetic loser in school, you're also a pathetic loser on your free time!"

Mikey frowned, stepping forward slightly, holding his arm out in front of Ray. "Who are you?"

"Mikey, don't." Ray warned, pushing his brother's arm out of the way. He didn't want Mikey getting involved with this jerk...but he also didn't want to be protected by his little brother either. Sean was bad news, your typical jerk jock who had more muscle than brains and a mean streak a mile wide. The self proclaimed king of the school had little time or patience for the smaller, weaker inhabitants of his kingdom and he wasn't afraid to show it off.

"Listen to your little brother, kid." Sean smirked, flexing his arm, an impressive bicep popping up. "Unless you want to get creamed."

"He's just a kid, leave him alone." Ray muttered, clenching his hands into fists. The two on either side of Sean were his friends, Steve and Jake. Both as dumb and mean as Sean, just not as talented on the football field. Teens of few words, they preferred to let their fists do the talking.

"If all you guys are going to do is be mean you can just go away." Mikey said, puffing his chest out, standing his ground. The older teens laughed at his posturing, Sean walking up to the kid and giving him a shove.

"Piss off, you little shit. We're not done playing with your brother." He said, his voice low and dangerous. Mikey stumbled back slightly and glared at Sean, stepping right back up and shoving him, hard. Out of shock more than anything, Sean stumbled back slightly, eyes wide. The kid was...stronger than he looked but that didn't matter. The bully clenched his hand into a fist and raised it, grabbing Mikey by the collar and lifting him up off his feet. Mikey was big compared to Ray but that didn't mean much when put against a group of boys who were also big for their age. Mikey struggled, kicking his legs, his toes connecting with Sean's shin with surprising force. Sean winced and shoved Mikey back, sending the kid to the ground. "Stay down if you know what's good for you, kid."

Sean turned his back on Mikey and cracked his knuckles. "Since your brother was just SO rude to us, I think I'm going to take it out on you, shrimp. Hold him."

Steve and Jake moved fast, grabbing Ray by his arms, holding him in place. Sean wasted no time, pulling his arm back and punching Ray in the gut. The first blow would have been enough to send him to the ground if he wasn't being held up. Before the second punch could come, however, Mikey was back on his feet, leaping onto Sean's back and wrapping his arms around the bully's neck, squeezing and trying to pull him back. "You...nngh...little brat!"

Mikey was tossed to the side like a rag doll but almost immediately sprang back up, aiming a kick directly at Sean's crotch, his foot connecting fiercely. Sean wheezed and fell to his knees, face turning red, mouth working wordlessly. Steve and Jake immediately dropped Ray and went to try and help their friend, Mikey grabbing Ray and tossing him over his shoulder, running back to their house. Ray, in shock, watched as the bullies seemed to shrink into the distance, the only sounds he could hear was the blood rushing in his ears and his younger brother's panting breath.

Both brothers were silent as they arrived back home, breathing hard, neither one looking at each other. Mikey's heart was pounding; he wasn't sure how Ray was going to react.
11411212211112.title: Little Brother, Big Protector

Summary of the next 2-3 years.
114112122111121.content:
Ray's emotions were mixed. On the one hand, he was humiliated for being saved by his little brother. On the other hand, he avoided a possible fight. He turned to Mikey and looked into his eyes. The boy's eyes reflected fear and despair. Ray understood that his younger brother was worried about how he would react to what had happened. He didn't want to hurt his little brother. So far, he has been very jealous of him and has neglected their relationship. Now he understood how much Mikey admired him. Maybe a little too much. And it’s not Mikey’s fault that he’s always been much taller than his contemporaries. And his current height can only be made by Ray"s own irresponsibility.
"Well, that situation could have been a lot worse." He smiled at Mikey. "But next time, don't attack a team of teens alone." He says laughing.
Mikey's eyes lit up with joy and his heart calmed down. "Ray doesn't hate me." He thought happily.
"Okay, next time we'll run away instantly." He answered Ray.
"Correct." Ray nodded. "Because it was very tiring for me to get revenge if you got in trouble."
“Would you take revenge on me?” Mikey wondered.
"Sure. You're my little brother. It's my job to take care of you and protect you." Ray replied emphatically. Then he hugged his brother.
Mikey hadn't heard such words from his brother in a long time. Sometimes he already thought Ray didn't like him. He knew himself to be bubbly and sometimes annoying and with that sometimes annoying his brother. Many times he tried to behave differently but when he was near Ray this side of him broke out again. He always loved and admired his brother. He is so calm and smart. He understood everything. And now Ray hugged him. Mikey was incredibly happy and promised himself to do everything he could to make Ray happy. "And growing up at any height, I'll always call him 'big brother'. And not just because he won the bet." Mikey promise to himself.
They went into the house. Ray took off his shoes. Mikey sat down to take off his sandal.
"Look, bro!" He shouted suddenly and raised his sandal feet in front of Ray's face. "My toes hang a little off the sandals." And to prove it he wiggled his toes.

114112122111122.content:
"Put me down, Mikey." Ray said quietly.

Mikey did just that, gently setting his older brother down and closing the front door. The larger boy winced a bit as the door clicked shut; those older kids had tossed him around really hard, and now it was starting to hurt. He rolled his shoulders a bit, and sighed as his back gave a satisfying pop.

Ray slowly walked down the hall, his fists clenching as he fought through a hundred confusing thoughts and feelings. He was so mad, at Sean, at Mikey, at...at...

"DAMN IT!" Ray howled, punching the wall. His fist broke through the drywall with a loud smacking sound, the gritty material scraped at his hands; damage from the only punch he'd managed to throw, after being saved by his little brother. God, he was so pathetic.

"Ray!" Mikey cried out, alarmed, and stared at the damaged wall. Wide eyed, the younger boy took a step toward his older brother.

"Back off, Mikey!" Ray yelled, whipping around to glare up at his brother.

Mikey froze for a moment, looking almost hurt. But then, something steeled in his expression.

"No."

In just a few short moments, Mikey easily cleared the distance and scooped his brother back into his arms, gripping him in a careful, but very firm hug. Ray started kicking his feet, dangling several inches above the ground, into his brother's shins, and pounded with his fists into Mikey's back as he felt the bigger boy's arms around his chest.

"I said to put me down, Mikey!"

"No." Mikey answered stubbornly as he carried Ray into the living room.

Ray kept squirming the whole way, shouting and teaching Mikey a lot of interesting new words, but the younger sibling had an iron grip on him. Eventually, Ray just got tired. His whole body sagged, limp in his brother's arms, and the older boy barely managed to hold in a whimper.

"It's not fair." Ray whispered, hating how weak he sounded. How weak he was.

"Are you going to keep breaking the house?" Mikey asked, trying for gentle but a bit too freaked out to pull it off.

"No," Ray sighed. "I'll let you do that when you're fifty feet tall next week."

Mikey dropped Ray, half in relief that his brother calmed down, half in disbelief.

"Don't be dumb." Mikey offered a weak laugh, falling back to fill up the nearby recliner.

Ray just shrugged. That probably was an exaggeration, but he didn't feel like being calm and sensible right now. Besides, for all he knew about Mikey and that stupid drink, it really would do that. Already, Ray could see Mikey's stomach easily as his shirt rode up, the kid's torso was stretching out as he wriggled into his chair and Ray didn't think he'd even noticed!

"There's no winning this for me, you know?" Ray sat down on the floor and started tracing circles in the carpet. "I'm not...mad at you Mikey. I'm...I mean, I'm really proud of you. You're really talented, and brave, and strong. But...but fighting those jerks at the park isn't going to help me, Mikey. I'm either the loser who can't stand up to Sean, or I'm the loser who got saved by his kid brother. I'm not supposed to need your help like that."

Ray glanced up, feeling really small weak, and saw his brother looking down on him with a confused expression. Mikey leaned forward in his chair, biting his lip as he tried to figure out what Ray meant.

"I don't understand." Mikey finally admitted as he frowned and tried to tug his shirt back into place. "I couldn't let them hurt you. I wanted to help. Why does it matter if I'm younger than you if I can help?"

Ray shrugged and tried to meet his brother's questioning gaze.

"Maybe you're right; it shouldn't matter. But it does matter. Big brothers are supposed to look out for their little brothers. I'm supposed to take care of you. I should be able to stand up for myself, and take care of myself. But I'm not strong enough."

"That's dumb."

Ray froze, staring up at his brother in shock. Mikey nodded, and hopped to his feet. From down on the floor, Mikey seemed to tower above Ray in his undersized clothes, and the older boy waited, confused, as the younger looked down with a determined smile.

"You think I should get all this extra help, and have you look out for me, and you get nothing?" Mikey shook his head. "You're right, that's not fair. You're taking care of the house, making sure I don't get in trouble while mom and dad are gone. Let me help you too!"

Mikey plopped down with a loud thump, and reached forward to swallow Ray's hands up in his own larger ones.

"You're my big brother. You're always helping me! But you shouldn't have to fight those bullies alone! I'm stronger than you are, Ray; please, just when you need me, can you let me be the big brother and help you?"
.

1141121221111222.content:
Faced with the sincere and pure feelings of his younger brother, Ray couldn't stand it any longer. He dropped his eyes and mumbled, "Mikey...your growth isn't...I mean...it's not normal."

Mikey, surprised by the sudden change of topic, said, "Uh...I know? I'm not as smart as you but I'm not a dummy either."

He giggled slightly but Ray pulled his hands free of his brother's grip and held them in turn, looking up with a serious gleam in his eye. "Remember that drink I got so mad at you for drinking?"

"Mmhmm." Mikey nodded, his mind already slowly starting to make the necessary links.

"Well...it was something I devised myself. It was supposed to stimulate my pituitary gland to help me get...taller. And stronger. But it needed time to settle and that's why it was in the fridge and then...you drank it." Ray explained.

"Woah...so that's why I'm suddenly getting so big so fast..." Mikey said, eyes widening as his mouth opened slightly.

"Exactly...but I'm not quite sure how much you'll grow. The formula was never intended to be taken by somebody prepubescent and you were already, genetically speaking, well on your way to getting big naturally so the effects on you might be..."

"Intense?" Mikey finished, heart thumping loudly in his chest, mouth dry.

"That's a good word for it." Ray sighed, closing his eyes.

"And...you didn't think maybe it would be smart to label it? Or even tell me about it?" Mikey said, laughing incredulously. "I mean...I guess I just drank it without thinking too but...but...this is so wild! I don't...I'm not sure....I mean, what should I be thinking?"

He ran a hand through his hair and tugged absently at his shirt. "I never signed up for any of this...but...it's just a lot to take in and I'm not really sure how much I understand, exactly."

Ray, having never considered how his brother might feel in all of this, a fact that brought about a pang of guilt in his chest, hastily moved to reassure his brother. "Well how about you let me run some tests on you? I can probably estimate the effects the formula will have on you and we'll have a better idea of how much you'll grow. It might be less extreme than I think."

"How extreme were you thinking?"

"...Remember my comment earlier about you being fifty feet tall?"

"...Oh boy."

Mikey flopped onto his back, staring at the ceiling, mind trying to process this information. "That's so...HUGE! Like...bigger than a house, normal people being like toys, ENORMOUS!"

Ray walked over to his brother's side and sat down next to him, his hand resting on his younger brother's exposed stomach, rubbing it gently. Mikey's introspective frown turned to a snorting giggle, his body shaking slightly as he forced himself to sit up, scrunching forward, trapping Ray's hand and stopping his movement. "H-Hey, don't do that!"

Ray smiled slightly and said, "Lets try to not freak out about all this until we know exactly what we're dealing with...deal? And from now on I'll be more...honest with you about these kinds of things. Does that sound fair?"

"Yeah..." Mikey said, letting Ray's hand go before enveloping him in a bone crunching hug. "I love you Ray, you know that, right?"

"Of course I do..." Ray said, awkwardly patting his brother on the back.

"So...if I DO get to be that big...and those jerks bully you again...can I just step on your school?" Mikey asked, grinning.

"What, before grabbing me and going all King Kong in downtown?"

"Ooh, ooh!" Mikey let out a monkey like grunt, pounding his chest and jumping to his feet. "Yeah! But this time, when all those planes fly by I'll just swat 'em down and be all like "Raaaaaar you dumb army dudes"!"

Ray chuckled as he watched Mikey stomp around in his now too small clothes, shaking the house. A weight had been lifted off his shoulders now that he had fully come clean to Mikey about the formula. Somehow, it eased the anxiety he had been feeling for the past few days now...though perhaps some of that easing had come from how quickly and willingly Mikey had offered to be his helper and protector. Why had he been so convinced that his little...younger...brother would only tease and ridicule him, making him feel small and weak? Just because the world treated him that way and Mikey liked to tease, as did all brothers, it didn't mean his kid brother would follow suit. It would take a little getting used to (these kinds of feelings didn't just disappear overnight after all) but maybe he could get used to having a giant protector...

His thoughts were interrupted as Mikey crashed to the floor, staring intently at Ray. "So...when did you want to run those tests? I guess right now?"

"It would be smartest to get them done as soon as possible, yes..." Ray said, thinking about it.

Mikey sighed, loudly, and said, "Yeah, I thought you'd say that...but we did a whole bunch of tests this morning already..."

Mikey's voice held a slight whine as he said this, his eyes turning up toward the ceiling. Ray pondered for a moment before shrugging. "Alright, it couldn't hurt to postpone them for just a day...first thing tomorrow morning we'll get it done, how does that sound?"

"Great!" Mikey shouted, lifting his arms up in triumph, a loud ripping sound filling the air as his shirt tore down the sides. "...Ooops..."

Mikey rose to his feet, looking himself over. He was quite a sight; his shirt was now ripped, the hem reaching just to the bottom of his chest, while his shorts now were hugging his hips so tightly they looked more like underwear, his long limbs looking thicker, his torso, the same. His proportions seemed to have been catching up with him even as his overall body size increased. The spurts seemed to be evening out, the operative word being "seemed". Mikey, fascinated, touched himself all over, the pinching hurt of the growth not nearly as pronounced as it had been earlier in the morning, his body acclimatizing to the changes. He tentatively reached a hand up and pressed his palm flat against the ceiling, without having to stand up on his tip toes at all.

"Cool~"

11411212211112221.content:
Mikey didn't spend long pressing the ceiling before his mouth opened in a jaw-splitting yawn. Ray could sympathize. It'd been a long day, and he felt physically and emotionally drained. Maybe it was best to put off any more revelations until morning. Holding back a yawn himself, the older brother took the younger by the hand and helped him to stumble up the stairs.

"Um...Ray?" Mikey asked sleepily as he tugged his shirt over his head. "What am I supposed to do for pajamas? I mean... I don't wanna sleep, "the younger boy looked around shiftily before blushing and whispering "naked."

Ray blinked, before taking in his squirming, embarrassed brother. Clothing was kind of an issue, and it wasn't like anything Ray owned was going to help here; he hadn't been that much bigger than Mikey to begin with, so even his baggiest spare clothes would be too small.

"Um....hold on. I'll be right back." Ray hustled down the hall and rifled through his parent's drawers. He was pretty sure Mikey was taller than their dad by now, but he didn't think the kid's waist had gotten that much wider. Indeed, when he brought over some clothes, Mikey looked down wide-eyed as he tried to tug the t-shirt down to his waist.

"Is dad's shirt too short?" Mikey asked in shock. Apparently the idea of outgrowing people besides Ray hadn't really occurred to him.

Ray passed over a pair of boxers as Mikey tried wrapping his head around the concept.

"Look, at least it mostly fits; these boxers should be fine too. You can sleep in those."

Mikey bit his lip, considering the slightly undersized clothing.

"Ray, if I really do get fifty feet tall, what am I supposed to wear? Where would I sleep?" The poor kid was starting to look a bit worried about his growth spurt.

Ray sighed. It was a fair thing to worry about, but the kid needed sleep. They both did.

"We'll talk about it in the morning." Ray offered, ruffling Mikey's hair. It seemed to help calm the younger boy down, especially since while sitting on his bed Mikey's eye level was a bit lower than Ray's. The older brother supposed that his over-sized kid brother really did still need him to take care of him after all.

"Okay," Mikey offered sleepily as he started lying down.

Thunk

Ray snorted as Mikey accidentally smacked his head on the headboard, misjudging where his head would land. He flicked the switch as he heard the covers rustle as his brother worked things out.

"Ray?"

Ray sighed. "What, Mikey?"

"I outgrew the bed. My feet are sticking out."

"....In the morning, Mikey."

"....Kay."

Ray's dreams that night were an odd mix of images. He had a vision of opening gifts on his birthday to find 'hand-me-downs' from Mikey; shoes that his feet would never grow enough to fill, shirts that looked like tents on his skinny frame. Images of the old doorframe where their parents used to mark the brother's heights, and how ever since around age five Mikey's marks were nearly even with Mark's from two years ahead. Ray saw himself alone in a giant's house, so big that he couldn't climb up onto the furniture or hope to reach the kitchen counter without a stool. While he looked around in confusion, he suddenly heard a distant, booming thump.

Thump, Thump, Thump

What was that? Were those....footsteps?

Ray's eyes shot open, glancing around his room nervously. Sunlight streamed in through the windows; he'd managed to sleep in a bit. Ray was glad; he felt a lot better, his head was clear.
