The laughter died out again when the sound returned, ferocious and demanding, Mikey's body needing even more fuel now. "Sorry uh..."big" bro but I think I need to eat more now."

"No, no, no. I know you're hungry, really I do, but that's only going to make this problem even worse. You're already almost passing through the ceiling, another binge eating session might make you too big to even fit out the front door!"

Mikey had a thoughtful look on his face as he imagined that, tilting his head slightly, a little smile curling the edges of his lips. "You really think so...?"

"YES I really do think so and that's why you have to control your urges, all of your....appetites." Ray said firmly, trying to impress upon Mike how important this was.

The sound came a third time, Mikey's belly roaring even louder than before, a pained look rising to the young boy's face. "Control this...why? Because I'll get bigger? That's probably just going to happen anyway. I'm not going to like..feel bad over it. It's not like any of this is my fault anyway. I'm hungry and I want to EAT."

Ray could hear the belligerence in his younger brother's voice and it made a chill run down his spine. "Okay...I mean, even if you did want to eat anything there's...there's no food left in the house, you ate it all the last time so...I'm sorry."

Mikey leaned forward, hands on his hips, his bigger face moving in close to Ray's, causing the older male to stumble back a few steps. An easy going grin rose to Mike's face as he said, "Then how about you order me some takeout?"

Ray cursed silently in his mind. He had been hoping Mikey wouldn't be focused enough to think of something like that. Now was the time to be brave, to be firm, to not let his little brother call the shots. Ray drew himself up to his full unimpressive height and said, "No. I said that you need to control yourself and that is what you are going to do."

Mikey's expression darkened for a moment, his lower lip pushing out in a pout before his eyes widened. He glanced around the room, thinking about something, a mischievous smile rising to his lips. "So wait...you said my teeth are getting stronger, right? And my body is getting more efficient?"

"Y-Yes? What about it?" Ray replied, happy to get off the subject of food for once.

"Nothing, just had a thought." Mikey said, casually strolling over to Ray's work table, his big feet making the floor shake slightly with his every step, his head scraping along the ceiling, sending bits of dust and plaster down onto Ray like snow. "If you're not going to feed me one way, you can feed me another way..."

Ray watched from a safe distance, honestly curious about what Mike was driving at, the much bigger male gently picking up a glass vial and bringing it up to his face, sniffing it, licking it...and taking a huge bite out of it! Ray immediately rushed over to the table. "Mikey! What the hell are you doing?! You can't eat glass!"

Mikey chewed thoughtfully for a moment before swallowing, smacking his lips a little. "Not much taste...but hey, it goes down easy!"

He giggled and took another bite, finishing the vial off quickly before dusting his hands. "Let's see...what else does my little big brother have to feed me?"

He picked up a beaker full of chemicals and downed the liquid in one shot before chewing up the beaker itself, licking his lips and letting out a little burp, the air rippling slightly. "And what's this? Notes? Looks like a sandwich to me!"

Ray, who had been watching in stunned silence as his monster of a little brother began to devour his work station, broke his paralysis and rushed forward, grabbing the other end of the notebook and tugging it back. "No! I need these notes! It's for the formula! Mikey, stop! I won't be able to make an antidote without this! STOP!"

Mikey lifted Ray clear off the ground as he brought the thick pad of papers up to his mouth, chomping into it, his eyes staring right into Ray's as he munched the notes, bringing his brother closer and closer to his lips, Ray letting go at the last second to avoid losing any fingers from Mike's careless eating, falling to the floor in a heap. Mikey let out a satisfied sigh as he licked his fingers, patting his flat stomach. "Stop? Come on bro, I thought you were smart! Did you really think that I would just...I dunno...sit around and be constantly hungry? To never do that thingy with my...um...you know, when it felt SO GOOD? To have you poke and prod and do boring experiments to me forever? No way! I want to have fun and do stuff and run around and show off how strong I am! You scientist types always try to lock up your creations and control them but I don't wanna be controlled! So I don't care what happens now! I'm going to do what I wanna do and I'm not going to let anyone stop me!"

His voice had grown louder and more passionate as he spoke, the window rattling in its frame again, Ray wincing at the volume of the noise. His heart was thudding in his chest; he couldn't believe he actually felt AFRAID of his little brother. He wasn't going to let anyone stop him? Ray knew that Mike wasn't invincible, that he could very well be stopped and yet...shards of glass were scattered around the table behind Ray, sprayed from Mikey's mouth while he had been eating, and yet not a single sliver of glass had managed to pierce Mikey's tougher skin. He certainly wasn't unstoppable but he was becoming...more. Something more than normal, more than average, more than human, even...the next evolution? The scientific part of Ray was tickled but that cold fear refused to dissipate. His thoughts were broken when he felt a huge, heavy, warm hand grip his shoulder. Ray immediately looked up into the kind face of his little brother, grinning that energetic grin, same as always. "Don't worry though...you're the one who helped me get like this so I'll make sure I take care of you no matter what!"

The pure affection in his voice was enough to banish that cold fear, at least for the moment, Ray smiling back...though that smile was short lived as Mikey leaned forward, stepping closer to the work table, gathering up more of his brother's beakers, vials, notes, pencils, and anything else he could get his hands on, stuffing them greedily into his maw. Ray was pinned, his back arching slightly over the table as the wall that was his brother's stomach and chest pushed against him, Ray's hands sinking slightly into the soft skin as he struggled desperately to push his brother back, not able to budge him even an inch. Once Mikey had devoured half the objects on the work table he stepped back and wiped his mouth, his stomach looking only slightly distended again. His capacity was much, MUCH larger now, not to mention his more efficient body was already breaking his "food" down faster, allowing him to store more. Mikey pointed to his still rumbling belly and said, "Okay little bro, I'm going to give you a choice now. Either start ordering some food or I'm going up to your room and eating everything in there...or as much of it as I can, anyway."

Ray, still torn between trying to stop his brother and mitigating the damage he would cause by being refused, chewed his thumbnail as he thought. What was the proper course of action here?

114112122111122212.content:
"Are t-OO-oo" Mikey said, playfully shoving his older brother, his voice minutely inflecting downwards in register at the end. He looked at Ray curiously for just a moment, then continued on his way into the kitchen.

Ray was slightly thrown. He must've just been imagining it. But as they sat down and munched through what Mikey, like a Hobbit, insisted was second breakfast, he couldn't get it out of his head. Was his voice deeper? Was he taller. Ray glanced under the table as Mikey shoveled another shoul of cereal into his mouth. Mikey really was a Hobbit in every way but height. Voracious appetite, and dusting of hair on the top of his fee--.

WAIT. Since when had Mikey had hair on his feet. Ray looked up across the table at his younger brother munching and slurping away at his meal. The kid was so focused on his food, it seemed unlikely he would notice a difference in his own size.

It was a curious realization though, on Ray's part. The formula was, after all, supposed to accelerate puberty, right? What did that mean for a boy like Mikey, who prior to drinking the formula was an early bloomer himself.

Ray's thoughts were disrupted by Mikey pushing his bowl away from himself. It was empty, the only evidence that there had been food anywhere near the table being some splashes of milk, and pieces of cereal on the table and on his brother. Mikey was still working on swallowing and chewing as he asked Ray what they should do next, so he couldn't quite gauge if Mikey's voice seemed deeper because it was muffled by all the food, or it was the effects of the formula. Either way, Ray decided they couldn't take the risk of bringing him out in public today, on the off chance that he grew exponentially, or something else happened.

"What do you think of this; we're starting to run low on food, so I'm gonna stop by the grocery store, and when I get back we can have a Star Wars marathon, original, NO prequels. How does that sound?"

Mikey acknowledged his older brother dumbly for a second, and then sputtered something along the lines of, "You-RE letTTing me STAY HOME ALOne". It was deeper. His voice was definitely getting deeper. He gave himself a self-satisfied smirk, "WoaH, I thiNK my voiCe is GETTING DEEpeR".

Ray stared at the young behemoth in front of him. If his voice was changing this fast, he should probably hurry with the food. "Yeah, I mean you're big enough to take care of yourself at this point, plus I thought you could just use some downtime. So, what do ya say? Movies when I get back?"

"SurE THING LIL BRO", he said giggling. Ray rolled his eyes, guess he'd have to get used to that at some point. He grabbed his shoes, the keys, and his wallet, with some of the money left over from their parents and headed for the door. "Alright Mikey, I'll be back in an hour tops! Put your dish in the dishwasher and get ready for this movie marathon!"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------


Ray wheeled through the aisles of store. He had already grabbed the essentials for the next couple of days, and some extras for their movie binge. Popcorn, Twizzlers, mike and ikes, m&ms, the works really. And now he found himself in the toiletry aisle. There was an assortment of deodorant, shaving cream, and razors in front of him. Judging by his little---No---younger brothers voice before he left, he figured he'd need at least one of these by the end of the week.

As the cashier rang up the toiletries, she gave him an odd look. She was probably his mom's age, mid 40s, and was likely confused as to why a teen, who looked no older than 15 and didn't have a wisp of hair on his face, was buying a pack of razors.

If only she knew.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The first thing that Ray heard when he walked into the house was running water. Mike must be showering. He guessed that was good, responsible, but the man-child had also left his bowl, and mess on the table. Guess he would have to have a word with his brother when he came down. As he was putting away some food on the lower shelf of the pantry, he felt a big hand fall on his shoulder, and a deep "BOO" come from behind him. Ray must've jumped a food in the air. His reaction was enough to earn a rumbling laugh from the boy behind him.

"What're you laughing at, and hey what's with you leaving your dishes just lying around after I left, I asked you to do one thing!" Ray stated indignantly.

"Sorry Ray, I took a poop right after you left, and then jumped straight in the shower, I swear I was gonna do it when I came down." It was hard to reconcile Mikey's earnestness, with the deep voice that it was carried by. He took in his brother's appearance too. He appeared to be in a pair of their fathers sweatpants, which end several inches above his ankles, which were surprisingly tight taboot, and wore no shirt. That wasn't altogether surprising. He looked thicker though, like his chest had puffed out, and arms had swollen bigger. Hell, he looked similarly proportioned to how he'd been before this mess. He had a clear six pack, and the faintest, barely noticeable line of blonde hair descending into his shorts, to a decidedly non-barely noticeable bulge.

Yep. The formula was definitely accelerating his puberty.

"You like what you see, little bro?" He hadn't realized he'd been staring. Ray brushed off his brother's comment quickly, with a snarky remark "No, just wondering what we'll put you in if you grow any more..."

Ray was not, however, prepared for his response of "Oh, I don't mind, I'm not ashamed of anything, haha..." Ray gave his younger brother an incredulous look, which only resulted in him laughing harder. He decided it was best to leave it at that, and told him they'd start the movie as soon as he got the rest of the food away.

"Oh, let me help ya little man," Mikey said coming up behind Ray, as he lifted some of the snacks and non-perishables onto a higher shelf, just out of reach of his brother, but at around eye'-level for himself. With that, and a couple more things, which would've taken Ray a whole bunch of maneuvering to put away had it not been for Mike's help, they set off for the family room. They each got their respective candies, and bowls of popcorn, and settled down on opposite sides of the couch, huddled under separate blankets, to watch the movie.

At some point during Episode 5, Mikey had fallen asleep. They had taken a break after the first one for dinner, which Mikey had eat plenty of. They had settled down for the next movie, and Ray looked over 3/4 of the way done to see his brother passed out. He wasn't too surprised, he had been growing in some sort of way today, it only made sense he'd be tired. It was the start of Episode 6 that he caught whiff of a pungent smell of body oder. Mikey's body was stretched out across the couch, his blanket only cover half his body, and relegating Ray to a single cushion. He was snoring with arms outstretched over his head, and a hint of a smirk on his face. As Ray catalogued all of this, he noted the beginnings of hair under his brothers arms, and the light blond dusting that seemed to be making its way up his legs.

Ray looked to the clock. It was 10:45, so Mikey would likely sleep through the night. No sense in bothering him hear either, he probably wouldn't fit in his own bed anymore. Ray reconsidered though, his parents might be big enough. He jostled his brothers shoulder, who awoke with a slow yawn and bleary eyes, "Hey Mikey, lets head up to bed, yeah". Mikey mumbled something in the affirmative, and they made their way upstairs, albeit slowly.

-------------------------------------------------------

Ray awoke with a start the next morning. He'd just had the weirdest dream. Mikey had accelerated even faster through puberty than he'd expected, and in this bizarre alternate universe had been twice the height of a normal man, with four times the muscle, and the angry attitude to go with it. He broken from his reverie, however, by a deep yell of suprise from the bathroom down the hall. Mikey! Hopefully nothing was wrong.

He raced down the hall to the bathroom, and budged on the door but it was locked.

"Mikey, let me in, whats wrong?! Are you all right?"

"Its--Everything--Ugh, I don't know---Do you promise you wont scream?" Ray was thrown, what could possibly be wrong.

"Mikey, I promise, just open the damn door" Ray yelled.

The first thing that hit him was the smell, pungent and like a man, it was somehow stronger than the night before. Then he took in his brother's appearance. He didn't seem taller at least, but that just about the only thing that hadn't changed. For starters, he had ballooned up in size muscularly, his pants could barely contain his legs.The biggest difference though was the hair. It was everywhere. On his face, on his chest, on his stomach, his legs, his arms. Everywhere. And it wasn't a dusting like it was yesterday. It was thick and tangled in places. Hell, forget 11, or 16, Mikey looked like he could be 30.

https://i.pinimg.com/736x/7d/fa/73/7dfa7...

"Well?" He looked down on Ray expectantly. Had his brother always been so small?

"I never imagined it would do this, dear lord," Ray mumbled.

Mikey was taken aback. "That's all you have to say for yourself, shrimp? I look like I'm dads age! How am I ever going to go back to school like this" He said angrily, stepping towards his brother, bumping him with the front of his body. Mikey knew it was irrational, but he was mad. Ray had an idea where it may have come from, the increased testosterone levels, but he was was frozen in shock by his brothers sudden hostility, and the apparent shift in the power dynamic.

Mikey huffed, and pushed past his little brother.

1141121221111222121.content:
Mikey shoved his way down the hall back to his parents room, where he had slept the night before. The first thing he was hit with as he entered the room was his now pungent body odor. Is this what all boys his brothers age smelled like after a day watching movies, or was he a special case. He went back to the mirror in his parents bathroom and assessed himself, rubbing his hand against his now rough cheeks. He'd always been big for his age, but this was unbelievable, his whole reflection barely fit within the constraints of the entire mirror, and the hair, it was everywhere. He knew from looking at both his father and brother, that generally being hairy didn't run in the family. In fact, if his brother was any indication, it didn't at all. He didn't seem much taller, thank goodness, but he had put on a good deal of muscle. It, coupled with his other situation, made him look closer to to the age of his parents, than the age of his brother. He'd never felt better though, the only thing nagging at him being his brother not telling him, or understanding that this is what the drink would do to him.

Ray, who barely came up to his chest now. Ray, who if they went out in public together, would probably be mistaken for his little brother. Why should Ray be able to tell him what to do, it wasn't like Ray could hurt him, Ray couldn't hurt anyone. He was a wimp, who had been dumb enough to put this formula in a place easily accessible to his younger brother. It wasn't Mikey's fault that Ray wasn't growing, and it sure as hell wasn't Mikey's fault that Ray was in the position he was in now. The more he thought about it, the more he got annoyed with his, 'little' brother.

He glanced at himself in the mirror. His muscles looked pumped, color reaching his cheeks as he took in his appearance. He then peered down at his fathers razor. How hard could it be.


-----------------------------------------------------------------


Meanwhile, Ray stood astonished in the hallway. Sure Mikey hadn't gotten any taller, noticeably at least, but he was almost a whole different person from the version of his brother he had seen the day before. It wasn't just that his muscles were bigger, or that his whole body had unceremoniously sprouted hair, his demeanor seamed to have changed too. He held himself differently, and dear god did he need to shower. Ray was sixteen and he hadn't even had an inkling of pit hair, let alone as pungent of body odor that his brother had. He decided it would be best start breakfast for the two of them. Knowing his brother, he'd be hungry when he was done doing whatever he was doing.


---------------------------------------------------------------


As he finished plating both his and his brothers meals, he heard the heavy footsteps of Mikey come lumbering into the room. He wasn't prepared to see a freshly shaved version of his brother, albeit with a slight mustache. Nor was he prepared for the vindictive glare coming his way.

1151.content:
"Bro? Brooooooooo! BROOOOOOO!"

Kurt grunted as he ignored his little brother's voice, loud as it was, focusing on the bicep curls he was in the middle of. He was well built for a sixteen year old, due to his diligence when it came to exercising and diet, and the fact that he played football. His red hair was cut quite short and close to his head, to make it easier to wear a helmet without too much extra matter getting in the way. He let the weight fall to the floor after his last curl, the sound attracting his younger brother to his room. Erik burst in, all smiles, stopping short in the doorway as the smell of his brother's active body hit his nose. "Woo! Yikes bro, can't you do this at the gym? It smells like a sock in here."

"No one's forcing you to hang out in here, shrimp." Kurt said with a laugh, rising to his feet and grabbing a nearby towel, pressing it against his face.

Erik chuckled and walked in, a look on his face that clearly said "I want to ask you something." Kurt ignored his brother for the moment, curious how long it would take before his brother just blurted out whatever he wanted to ask. Unlike him, Erik was short and stocky. He had a solid build but wasn't what would be considered fat, with the same fiery red hair as his brother but longer and with a splash of freckles across his cheerful face. He was as energetic as they came and moved around a ton, despite his size. The extra thickness probably came from his love of food; it wasn't surprising to see him with some kind of food item in hand. Finally, Erik quickly said, "Can Hiro come over and play? Please?"

Kurt pretended to think long and hard about it. Since their parents were away so often on business trips, Kurt had naturally slipped into a kind of parental role for Erik; not to the point that it ruined their relationship as brothers, but enough that, even when their parents were around, Erik tended to come to Kurt instead. "Sure, he can come over."

"WOOHOO!" Erik yelled, throwing his arms up in the air, before plunging his hand into his pocket and pulling out his cellphone. "Hiro, he said yes! Get over here!"

Kurt chuckled, watching his brother bound from the room. He was still only twelve, not quite at that tipping point where youthful innocence starts to congeal into teenage angst, so he could be a bit of a handful at times, but Kurt wouldn't have traded him for any other brother. It didn't take long before the doorbell was heard. Hiro only lived down the street so it never took long for him to arrive. Erik ushered him in, Kurt catching a glimpse as he moved towards the bathroom to take a shower. Hiro was quite a bit different from Erik. Where Erik was on the shorter side for his age, Hiro was on the taller side. Where Erik was thick, Hiro was skinny. Where Erik had shorter hair, Hiro's was longer and shaggy. Nevertheless, the two had been inseparable for years, since they met in elementary school. They both enjoyed the same kind of things and would often engage in friendly competitions to see who could come out on top. Mental games were usually won by Hiro, who was a bit more talented in the smarts department, where physical challenges usually favored Erik, with his stockier, more powerful build. Still, both boys had managed to surprise the other various times by winning a competition they were sure they had in the bag. By the time Kurt was done with his shower, both boys were already settled in Erik's room, playing some kind of fighting game.

The doorbell rang again, much to Kurt's confusion, as they weren't expecting anyone else to come over. Hurrying downstairs, he opened the door only to find a package left on the doorstep. Scratching his head, he brought it in and opened it up. Inside was a pill bottle, unmarked beyond a single instruction which read "Take one with your meal", and a note. Kurt read the note, eyes scanning back and forth.

"Revolutionary supplement! Take one with your meal and see INSTANT results! Not intended for those over thirteen, results may vary."

Kurt raised an eyebrow and crumpled the note up, tossing it into the trash. He dumped the pill bottle onto the table and broke down the box, tossing it out into the recyclables before pulling his cellphone out, calling his mom's number, which went straight to voice mail, and then his father's number, yielding the same results. Rolling his eyes slightly, Kurt left a message. "Hey dad, it's Kurt. We just got a really WEIRD package that had a pill bottle in it. You know anything about that? Is this some kind of weird gift? Call me back."

He went back inside and froze as he saw the pill bottle was gone, the cupboards opened, and the evidence of two boys making a snack left out on the table. Rushing upstairs, Kurt burst into Erik's room, both boys yelling at the sudden intrusion. "Did you two take that bottle?!"

"Y-Yeah!" Erik said, holding the bottle up. "There was only two in there though... sorry bro."

"We thought you left it out for us." Hiro said, blushing slightly, eyes cast to the side. "It looked like a vitamin or something..."

"Are you two feeling sick? Light headed? Upset stomach?" Kurt persisted.

"No... why?" Erik asked, taking a bite out of his sandwich.

"No... reason." Kurt said, not wanting to freak the kids out. "Look... if either of you two feel... weird, just let me know. And Hiro? I think you should stay the night."

"What really? Awesome!" Hiro said, lighting up at the invitation. Both boys high fived as Kurt left the room, examining the bottle. So long as the boys were feeling fine he wouldn't worry... but maybe there was some kind of clue on the bottle he had overlooked. Turning it over, he found, on the bottom, a symbol. It was a little hard to make out but it looked like...

11511.content:
The symbol at the bottom of the bottle was worn a little, but after a moment Kurt recognized the shape of a dumbbell, with a circle and line over top of it. Below that, was a 1-800 number in small, almost-impossible to read type. Squinting his eyes, Kurt made his way downstairs to the brighter kitchen light, then pulled out his cell phone and typed in the number.

After a single ring, a recorded message on the other end picked up. “Hello,” said a male voice, with a weird, unplaceable accent to it. “You’ve reached Kyouto Pharmaceuticals, makers of Revolutionary Supplement! This recording is for you to discover warnings for the supplement. The supplement will not be effective for those over thirteen. To avoid overdose, make sure to include with meal with plenty of protein. And most important, for at least 24 hours after taking supplement, avoid any strenuous activity, including running, weightlifting, and so on. Kyouto Pharmaceuticals is not responsible for any effects that occur if these warnings are not followed. Thank you goodbye!”

Kurt scrunched up his nose as he dropped his phone to his side. Looking at the chip bags left out on the counter, Hiro and Erik probably hadn’t included any meat in their snack, so that already was a red flag. And It would be extremely difficult to keep the two friends from getting into any kind of strenuous activities, as they seemed to always be doing things like running around or wrestling with each other. The whole thing seemed really irresponsible for a company to send out with barely any printed instructions.

He began to bring his phone back up to try reaching one of his parents again, but before he could dial their number, he heard a loud crashing coming from upstairs. Dropping the phone, he bolted back up the stairs, taking them two at a time.

***

“It’s really cool of your brother to invite me to stay the night,” Hiro said as he leaned back in the beanbag chair and grabbed the controller again, brushing his long black hair out of his eyes with his free hand. “And my parents are both out of town too, so I would have had to spend the night at my Aunt’s otherwise. You know how much of a dictator she is.”

“Ugh,” Erik agreed as he rubbed his hand on his jeans to get rid of the chip dust and grabbed the second controller, sitting down on the edge of his bed. “Yeah, I’m glad you can stay. But I think I know why you’re really excited to stay over.” He flashed a mischievous grin towards Hiro as he booted up the game console.

The taller, skinnier boy tilted his head and frowned. “What? Why?”

Erik leaned towards him and lowered his voice to just above a whisper. “Because you want to sneak into the bathroom while Kurt is taking a shower and spy on him again.”

Hiro’s eyes lit up as his olive cheeks turned red. “S-shut up. That wasn’t on purpose. I-I just really had to use the bathroom!”

“Then why didn’t you use the downstairs one?”

“Because—” Hiro started, but couldn’t think of a good response. “Just—shut up about that.”

“Oh, really?” Erik said, continuing to taunt. “Wouldn’t you rather sneak in while *I’m* in the shower?”

“N-no!” Hiro stammered, becoming more and more flustered. “Take that back!” Throwing down the controller, he jumped to his feet and then leapt at Erik, half-tackling him as they rolled off the edge of the bed and landed on the ground with a loud crash.

“Oof!” Erik said as his butt hit the thick carpet, which luckily absorbed most of the impact. After a momentary shock, he then grinned, pushing up against Hiro and forcing the lighter-weight boy over, until he was on top. His legs straddled Hiro’s hips while he pinned his wrists to the ground, his smile becoming even wider. “Is this how you like it? With me on top?”

Hiro struggled in vain to try and move Erik off of him, eventually resorting to kicking his legs as much as possible. “Get off!”

“Is that what you—”

Erik’s retort was interrupted by the door to his bedroom slamming open. “What the hell are you two doing?” Kurt yelled, his imposing frame filling the doorway. “Stop that now!”

The two friends both knew when Kurt was being serious. Erik rolled off and stood up, grinning sheepishly, while Hiro leaned up against the side of the bed, trying to catch his breath.

“Are you two both all right?” Kurt asked, looking over both of them carefully. “I called the number on the pill bottle, and you’re not supposed to do anything too strenuous for a while after you take them.”

“Relax, bro, we’re both fine.” Erik said, waving his hand dismissively. “Right, Hiro?”

The brothers both turned their heads to look at Hiro, who wasn’t responding, and was now leaning forward, hugging his knees. “Hiro?” Kurt asked, bending down to get a closer look at him. “Are you hurt?”

“I—I—” Hiro said between gasping breaths. “No, I just feel really weird. Like all tingly and—and—”

Before he could finish his sentence, Hiro suddenly…

It was like watching some strange form of nature strip in fast motion, like one of those clips of a plant rapidly growing. One second Hiro was sitting there, his normal self, and the next, accompanied by several harsh gasps, he began to sprout up! Hiro instinctively jerked back away from Erik, pulling Kurt back with him as a mother would pull a child back from a hot stove.

Even from a seated position, Erik's head was still in the second story of the house, but enough of the floor had been demolished that he could look down and see Hiro and his brother below him. "Okay, bro, you got what you wanted. I'm sitting on my butt. What do you want to do now?" He grinned mischievously as he stretched out his legs on either side of the two smaller boys.

Kurt gulped, noticing for the first time that his brother's feet were almost as long as he was tall. And, the way he was sitting, Erik was making no attempts to hide his arousal, which still rose up from his hips at full mast. He turned around, only to realize that Hiro, too, had moved to a similar seated position. While he was nowhere near as large as his brother was (at least, not yet), he, too, seemed to be as excited about the situation as Erik was. Unlike his brother, though, he found that Hiro's presence and mannerisms were calming, even as a giant, almost— attractive? No, that's not how he felt. At least, Kurt didn't think so.

Looking out the window, Kurt saw that the storm seemed to be dying down, though the rain continued. Maybe it would be best to just make a break for it, Kurt thought, and go try and find someone who could help. But who would he go to? Police? A hospital? Who would even believe him? And he couldn't just abandon his brother like that, no matter how big he was getting, could he? No, he decided. He would stick it out with the two growing boys until the end, and try to figure out the best way to handle this so that they didn't get hurt.

"Ahem," Erik cleared his throat, growing impatient while waiting for his brother to answer. "If you don't have any ideas, maybe I can provide a suggestion."

Kurt gulped, fearful for what his brother would suggest

121.content:
Saul felt anticipation build through him as he watched the familiar sights pass by the wagon window. It had been one year since he had left for Mages Academy to pursue his education in the magical arts. It had been tough, leaving home and living away from his family, but once a year he was allowed to go home and visit his family.

As the wagon rolled by, he couldn't help but notice how much things have changed. Some of the stores had closed down and been replaced, some of the buildings had been remodeled, and there were a lot more people than he remembered. Thinking about how things have changed made him wonder if he had changed as well. He was still the somewhat scrawny boy with chestnut brown hair and steel grey eyes. He wasn't very large and would be considered underweight compared to the other village boys, but then again mages weren't known for being muscle bound brutes.

Finally the wagon stopped in front of his home. A wave of nostalgia washed over Saul as he stepped out and stood in front of his family's bakery, the Golden Crumb. It was a small, humble ordinary bakery that supplied bread and baked goods to many of the locals. The wagon man helped him unload his luggage down and rode off, leaving Saul by himself to take in the sight.

"Well, guess I should head in and see if they need my help." Saul grabbed his luggage's handle and walked through the doors. Immediately he was greeted by the door bell, the sound welcoming him back home. Inside there were shelves were covered with breads, pastries and cakes all ready to be sold...though there were a lot less than he was used to seeing. Before he could make any deeper observation, someone came in from the back.

"Welcome to the Golden Crust, how may I- Saul!?" A small blur rushed from behind the counter and tackled Saul, nearly knocking him down. "Saul, you're home!" Tomas said, hugging his brother tightly.

"Yes, I'm home." Tomas smiled and ruffled the hair of his little brother. Tomas looked exactly like he left him, a small, smiling skinny boy with golden brown hair that resembled wheat and blue eyes. "Where's Mom and Dad?"

"Mom's at the market and Dad went to the lumberyard to order firewood." Tomas told him as he pulled back.

"So who's running the shop?" Saul asked.

"I am!" Tomas said, proudly puffing out his chest. It wasn't very impressive considering how flat it was, but Tomas seemed to think it was.

"Well then, I guess I should help you out until Mom and Dad get back." Saul said, rolling up the sleeves of his robes.

"Alright, but you gotta take orders from me! We can't have you baking any bad bread, otherwise you'll scare off the last of our customers."

"Last?" Saul frowned as he followed his brother to the back.

"Yea, ever since that Duke Huffington and his bullying sons bought off most of the stores and land around here, he's been pressuring other shop owners and stealing their customers so he can force them to sell their business to him for cheap. But not the Golden Crust! We're gonna show him that his new bakery down the road can't hold a candle to the bakery that's been in our family for four generations!"

"Is that so?" Saul said, though a part of him started to worry. That would explain the crowd up the street and why there was so much less being sold in the store.

Tomas didn't seem to dwell on it however, as he went to a sack of flour and lifted it. Or at least, tried to. The poor boy could barely get one end of it a few inches off the ground. He was too skinny and weak to be able to lift a thirty pound sack. In fact, Tomas looked like he was the exact same size and weight as when Saul left him the year before. He should have at least grown a little bit, especially since this was a period when you could practically see a boy grow before your eyes. At least he's one thing that hasn't changed. He thought and went to help his brother.

Later that night their parents came home and they had a splendid dinner to celebrate Saul's return. Their mother and father both didn't show and concern about the duke, and instead focused their attention on Saul.

"So Saul, did you learn any new tricks at that fancy school of yours?" Their Dad asked.

"Oh plenty, I've spent hours studying on all sorts of spells, potions and other stuff."

"Can you show us one of your magic tricks?" Tomas asked eagerly.

"Spells, not tricks. Tricks are for street magicians with no real magical talent." Saul corrected him.

"Whatever, just show me a trick already!" Tomas bounced in his seat.

Saul rolled his eyes. "Alright, let me try this new spell I've been learning." He pointed at Tomas and chanted the spell. A spark flew out and hit his brother in the chest. The four of them waited anxiously to see the effect, but seconds dragged by and nothing happened.

"Is that it?" Tomas asked, rubbing the spot the spark had hit him.

"Funny, that should have worked." Saul frowned.

"Exactly what were you trying to do?" Their mom asked.

"Oh, I was trying to make Toma's hair and toenails grow ten inches."

"What!?" Tomas quickly reached up to the top of his head, then pulled up his feet to check.

"Saul..." Their father gave a warning tone.

"I was just joking Dad." Saul said, smiling. "Here, let me show you some other stuff that will are guranteed to work!" The rest of the night Saul performed simple spells, keeping his family entertained. By bed time they had completely forgotten about the little "failed" spell from earlier.

Settling into his old bed, Saul sighed contently. It felt good to be home again. Although he would only be there for a short time, Saul was looking forward to helping out his family. He was especially looking forward to spending time with Tomas, the 10 year old easily got excited about anything. Closing his eyes, he went to sleep.

The next morning...

"Ha! Pinned ya again!"

Aaron only grinned in reply, ruffling the hair of Tyler, his younger brother, who was lying on top of him. Of course, "pinned" wasn't really the right word, as Tyler's legs and arms couldn't even reach all the way around the chest of the bigger, more muscular tiger. But it didn't really matter; after all, they were just roughhousing and having fun with each other.

"That's two for me, none for you!" Tyler exclaimed as he rolled off onto the floor. "I win!"

"Awww, dang it!" Aaron pouted playfully. "C'mon, best three out of five?"

Tyler rolled his eyes and shook his head. "Nah, Aaron, I know you're letting me win. Thanks, but I think we can stop... for now." Leaning in, however, Tyler gave him a playful punch on the arm. "But some day, I'll be as big as you-- or even bigger! Then we'll have a fair fight!"

"Yeah..." Smiling softly and nodding, Aaron nevertheless couldn't help himself from doubting that. After all, the ten-year-old tiger was definitely on the scrawny side. At 4'4" and 80 pounds, he was even outsized by some of the mouse and bat kids in his class. Why, when he was his age, Aaron would've been almost a foot taller and twice as thick. He knew that Tyler would probably hit a growth spurt at some point, but he was starting to think that might not be enough to help him catch up.

Maybe, Aaron thought to himself as he watched Tyler start doing some sit ups, I can find something that could provide a little boost.

*****

The tall brawny tiger walked down the aisles of the nutrition store, not even sure that they'd have what he was looking for here. Sure, he'd bought plenty of protein shakes and muscle enhancers here before, but he had naturally been graced by a height over seven feet tall, so it had never occurred to him to look for anything that helped overall size before. At least, until now.

He had to go through nearly three-quarters of the store before he found something that looked like it would fit the bill. QuickSprout Powder, the label read. Can provide up to an extra six inches in height in just eight weeks! Just stir two spoonfulls in with water! Scanning the rest of the shelves around it, Aaron didn't see anything else that looked similar, and he realized he was holding the last bottle. Figuring that it was either a hot ticket item or on clearance, he quickly made up his mind to purchase it, bringing it to the counter along with his regular monthly supplements.

Perhaps he made up his mind a little too quickly, however, for if he read the rest of the bottle, Aaron would've noticed a warning label: WARNING: Keep out of the reach of children who are going through or haven't yet entered puberty. If a child ingests this product, please call this number immediately...

***

Scooping in two spoonfuls into a mostly-full glass, Aaron watched as the powder quickly dissolved. He brought it up to his nose, sniffing it. There wasn't any odor as far as he could tell, and the powder seemed to fade into the water, nearly completely invisible. "Hmmm, I suppose a third spoonful wouldn't hurt," he murmured, as he mixed another one in. Thoroughly stirring the drink, he then brought it into the living room, where Tyler was lying on the couch, watching TV.

"Here," Aaron said as he handed Tyler the glass. "Try this. It's something I picked up at the nutrition store."

The younger tiger grabbed the glass and peered into it. "What is it?"

Aaron paused, trying to decide just how much of the truth he should tell Tyler. "It's... something that will make sure you grow up well," he finally said.

Shrugging, Tyler brought the glass to his lips. He slowly lapped at it first, then, as his eyes lit up, he started drinking it faster. Aaron noticed the tip of his brother's tail seemed to flick back and forth excitedly as he drank the mixture. He must like it, he thought.

As he finished, he lowered the glass and let out a loud, satisfied sigh. "Aaah, that was great!" he exclaimed. "I might want some more of that soon!"

"Heh," Aaron chuckled, "well, I'll keep it in the pantry next to my stuff. Just let me know when."

"Okay!" Tyler beamed, as he suddenly leapt to his feet, seemingly bouncy and full of energy. This startled Aaron, but after a moment he shrugged it off. Kids, he thought, shaking his head.

A large, black-furred hand ruffled Kyle's hair before Jason grabbed his hoodie as he flung the door open, slipping it on as he shut the door behind him.

Kyle sighed. Jason never wanted to do anything with him, always hanging out with his friends. Pouting, Kyle trudged up to his room, thinking about all the things he wanted to do with his brother, ranging from playing to simply talking. Catching sight of the time on his clock, Kyle wondered why anyone would want to be out so late - a look out the window confirmed that the sun had long set.
After pulling on his pyjamas, Kyle sat on the edge of his bed, not wanting to go to sleep.

A pinprick of light in the sky slowly moved, a tiny trail behind it. Kyle's eyes widened when he realised what it was; a shooting star! Sure, it wasn't like it was going to make his wish come true, or anything...

...but it couldn't hurt, just in case it somehow did.

Eyes focused on the shooting star, Kyle looked through his mind for a wish to make, and one thing stood out. "I wish... That my older brother would notice me..." He said after a moment's hesitation. The shooting star quickly faded from view, the light too dim to continue being seen by the young boy.

Feeling tired, Kyle elected to slip under his covers, quickly falling asleep. Little did he know it, but his wish was going to come true - just not in the way he imagined, and not right away. Kyle was four feet and eleven inches tall, around average height for his age. But he was going to get much, much bigger...

How does Kyle grow as a result of the wish?

1333.content:
Kyle bolted up in the middle of the night, wheezing, something very tight wrapped around his torso and legs. He was greeted with the loud ripping noise of his shirt tearing to shreds and falling to the floor in three or four pieces, torn to shreds. He reached over and to turn on his bedside lamp and see just what had made a loud sound (and why his legs still felt so tight and constricted but now his upper body felt free), and jumped a little as he heard another loud rip. Turning on his light, he gawked at how small his pajama pants now looked. Looking over onto the floor, he saw the stretched and torn remains of his shirt. His bed seemed to make weird, groaning sounds whenever he moved, much more than it usually did; looking around the room, everything seemed strangely smaller than it should be--he took up more space on the bed than he usually did, he'd almost pulled the lamp onto the floor,

Kyle was not just confused by this massive flurry of new information...he was terrified. What the hell had happened? Why did everything look suddenly so small? Why were his clothes so tight? Why...did he have such a large bulge in his pants? The questions swirled around in his head until he let out an exasperated, "What's happening to me?"

He attempted to get up and check himself out in the mirror (whatever was wrong clearly was with him, and not the rest of the room), but his legs were fastened together by his now much to small for him red pajama pants. He reached down and tried to pull them off, but it was no use--they were stuck to him. He sighed heavily as he tried to pull his legs apart, succeeding after a little effort at tearing the pants down the crotch seam. They were still wrapped around his legs, but at least this way he could actually get up, and he managed to hobble his way over to the mirror.

He was shocked by what he saw. In the back of his mind, he suspected that maybe he'd gotten a little growth spurt in the night--he was pretty small for a twelve year old, and had been waiting for his growth spurt to kick in for a while. The change in his size was by no means little, however; he was at least six feet tall now, probably closer to six and a half! He also used to be fairly scrawny--the figure looking back at him from the mirror would never be mistaken for a bodybuilder or anything, but he was definitely more muscular than he'd been. He held up his arm and flexed it a little, audibly gasping at how big it had gotten.

What could have caused this? He couldn't think of anything he'd done over the last day that was really out of the norm, except for...could the wish he made on that shooting star have caused this? He dismissed the thought as ridiculous--it was much more likely that the fox had somehow been exposed to some weird compound in the hamburger he'd had for dinner, and he did think the tap water tasted a little funny...

A loud tearing noise (a sound he was getting all too familiar with hearing at this point...) jarred him from his train of thought. He looked down and saw his right pant leg rip open, followed quickly by his left, leaving him completely nude save for a pair of bright red boxer briefs that were fighting a losing battle to contain his bulge...

153.content:
Kyle gritted his teeth and clenched his fists as he stormed away from the entrance to the roller coaster. His 17-year old brother Daniel had taken Kyle and his two other 12-year-old triplet brothers, Craig and Clay, to the state fair, which had gone well right up until they had decided to get in line for the Cyclone roller coaster. Of course, they had waited in line for nearly an hour before they got to the front, only to find out that Kyle (being an inch shorter than his same-age triplets, which had been a constant source of irritation nearly since they had been old enough to talk) was the only one of the group too short for the height requirement. Of course, Craig and Clay had taunted him about this even as they got on and he stormed down the exit ramp. Their voice still rang in his ears, even though they were heading up the hill right now.

"Stupid height requirement," he muttered to himself. "Stupid Clay and Craig. If only I could be the bigger brother for once. Then things would be different.

As he was steaming, he looked up and noticed a strange-looking tent just a few steps away. The tent was tiny, barely big enough for more than two people to stand in at a time. At first he thought that it was something for the employees, but then he saw the small sign that hung just to the right of the entrance flap. "WishGiver?" he read aloud, scrunching up his nose in confusion as he did. What the heck was that? He had been to the state fair each of the last four years, and he didn't remember any WishGiver.

He hesitated to go in, but decided that it was worth a shot. After all, it'd still be another 3-4 minutes until his brothers were off the Cyclone, and what harm could it be. Besides, since he didn't have to use the 8 tickets they did to go on the roller coaster, he had extras and could easily afford the apparent 2-ticket entrance fee for this tent.

It took a few seconds for his eyes to adjust to the low candlelight of the tent once he stepped inside. Before they had done so, he heard a low, almost whispering voice: "Ah, yes. Kyle, my son. I have foreseen your arrival. Welcome."

Kyle's eyes went wide. How did this guy know his name. He glanced downward, thinking he may have a nametag or something on from a previous booth, but nothing said his name on it. He felt a shiver run down his spine as he replied, "T-thank you."

"Do you have your two tickets?" Kyle nodded, handing the tickets over to the man, whom he could now see was rather old and bearded, or at least dressed up with makeup to look that way.

The old man took the two tickets and quickly placed them below the table's surface. "Ah, wonderful. And the universe has already heard your desire. You wish to be bigger, do you not?"

Again, Kyle felt his blood turn cold. Either this guy had amazing hearing and could hear Kyle muttering to himself over the noise of the rest of the carnival, or something truly weird was going on. Still, even if the chances that all of this was real were remote, if it did turn out to be true...

"Kyle?" the old man repeated, seeing Kyle lost in thought.

Swallowing hard, Kyle again nodded. "Yes. I want to be big. Bigger than my brothers, bigger than my parents-- bigger than everybody, really."

For a moment, the old man didn't reply, staying still as stone. Kyle began to grow nervous, and was about to say something, when he finally answered, "The universe has granted your request, and offers you to grow one percent taller."

"One percent?!" Kyle scoffed. "That's barely anything at all!"

Though he could barely see the old man's face, Kyle could've sworn he saw a smile spread across his lips. "Don't dismiss the power of one percent, my son, for this is not just a single instance, but a cumulative effect, and can lead to amazing results. Not only this, but you have a choice of how that effect will accumulate. Each of these choices will take effect at midnight on October 1st, or about fifteen minutes from now. The first choice represents a quick satisfaction, the second choice will be more long-term, and the third choice will be eternal."

This only served to confuse Kyle even further. "What?"

Letting out a slight sigh, the old man waved his hand and produced three cards, seemingly out of thin air. "Our time must draw to a close, so I'll explain it for you as simply as possible, and then you can take these cards and make your choice, as long as it's before the stroke of midnight."

He handed Kyle the first card, which had an image of a wristwatch on it. "This card represents the quick solution. If you choose this, you will grow 1% a minute for the entire day, but only that day." He paused for a moment, then handed Kyle the second card, which had a picture of a calendar on it. "This card represents the long-term solution. By choosing this, you will grow 1% every hour for the entire year." After waiting another few seconds, he finally handed the last card over. At first, Kyle thought it had a figure eight, but then he quickly realized he was holding it sideways, and it was the infinity symbol. "And this card represents the eternal choice. Select this, and you will grow 1% every day for the rest of your life. Choose wisely, my son, and good luck."

His eyes bulging, Kyle stared at the cards. He had so many questions running through his head, but as he looked back up, he was stunned to see that he was standing back outside, still in the place he was at, but the tent he had been standing in just a moment ago had vanished. Glancing to his left, he noticed that his brothers had just stepped off the roller coaster and were heading down the ramp towards him. Was it just a dream, he wondered.

"Hey, short stuff," Clay said with a smirk. "You missed a hell of a ride. What do you got there?" he pointed at the cards that Kyle was holding in his hands.

"Uhh, nothing," Kyle said, quickly pocketing the cards. It can't be a dream if I still have these, right? he thought. What the old man was saying is impossible, though. But ... what if it's not...?

He glanced at his watch, which read 11:57. He only had a few minutes to decide, he realized, or lose the chance, according to what he had been told. As his brothers continued on to the next ride, he hung back a few steps behind them, mulling his decision over in his mind. Finally, he decided on which wish he wanted. He held out one of the cards, saying "I choose this one," just before his watch beeped and switched over to 12:00. As soon as the words left his mouth, the other two cards vanished, leaving him holding only one card.

The card he had chosen, the one that was still left in his hands, just so happened to be...

1531.content:
“Think you’re big enough to ride this one shorty.”

Clay’s usual snide remark bounced off Kyle, who was still pondering the wristwatch image staring back at him from the palm of his hand.

“What will 1% a minute do,” he pondered, “For someone as short as me?”

A pair of hands suddenly jerked his shoulders. The sudden jolt snapped Kyle up, forcing him to drop the card.

“I said, you think you can handle this one… short stuff!”

Kyle’s skin inflamed. Clay’s constant joking at Kyle’s expense grated on him more and more with each passing year. Clay argued with Daniel, ignored Craig and always reserved special torment for Kyle. Just beyond, the Haunted House loomed above them all. Rows of painted ghosts and snarling demons danced across the tall metal sheets, the endless flashes of strobe lights giving them an eerie life. Clay KNEW Kyle hated this ride. In addition to being the shortest, Kyle was also the most sensitive and HATED to be scared.

“Seriously, Clay?”

“Oh yeah, Kyle. I picked it out special. Daniel felt so bad you couldn’t come with us on the roller coaster, so I said we had to find one your own size.” Clay squeezed Kyle’s shoulders, holding him in place.

“Just because the haunted house is on tracks, doesn’t mean it’s a roller coaster.”

“Still,” he squeezed harder, Kyle’s flesh giving instantly under his grip, “It’s going to be so much fun.”

“To watch me scream,” Kyle he muttered.

“What was that LITTLE brother?”

A mechanical cackle stole Kyle’s reply. Huge demonic eyes over fifteen feet in the air glowed with blood red heat. Kyle’s stomach twisted. Taking full advantage of Kyle’s distraction, Craig creeped his head closer and closer to his frightened brother, hanging it mere inches over Kyle’s bony shoulder. Goosebumps ran up Kyle’s neck, all the way through the tips of his short red hair.

Clay belted a sharp scream, an inch away from Kyle’s ear. Kyle jumped with an uncontrollable yelp! Clay died of laughter.

Kyle recovered his breaths as fast as he could. “Someday,” he gasped, “when I grow up… you will not treat me like this ever again.”

Clay laughed harder. “Like what, BIG man!?”

Clay bounded toward Daniel and Craig with a devilish laugh, leaving Kyle alone once again. Taking a small gulp, Kyle reached down to pick up his lost card, but it was gone. He looked again and sure enough, the patches of dirt and grass beneath his shoes were clear.

No card.

Kyle checked his pocket with a few quick shoves, but the other cards too were gone. Kyle wasn’t sure what was more scary, the haunted house staring him down or the old man’s magic seemingly at work. His stomach twisted again.

“I hope I don’t regret this.”

Kyle finally filed in behind the shrinking line of excited kids and expressionless adults. As he approached the ticket taker, Kyle saw his brothers already seated in the paint chipped carts. Craig and Clay were in the first car, while Daniel saved a seat in the car directly behind them. This relieved Kyle some, happy his older brother was taking an effort to keep Clay away from him.

Kyle reluctantly handed over his ticket to the thin, pot marked teen and sat down next to his older brother. Although Daniel shared the trio’s red hair and pale complexion, he had a more “chiseled” look than his youthful brothers. His eyes pierced with intensity, and his fuller frame held a secret strength his brothers knew well.

“You actually joined us?” Craig incredulously asked. “Don’t you hate this ride?”

“No!” Clay interrupted. “Haven’t you heard? Kyle’s growing up. He’s not scared of a little ride at the carnival.”

Silence hung in the air.

“Are you… Kyle?” Clay smiled mockingly.

Daniel audibly gritted his teeth. Kyle’s mouth opened, but words never emerged.

“See!” Clay sneered. “He’s fine!”

The attendant appeared from nowhere, snapping the metal bar over Daniel and Kyle’s legs. The cold steel loomed inches over Kyle’s thin legs, stopped by Daniel’s larger thighs. This did little to calm Kyle’s panic. He was trapped and going nowhere. Seeing Kyle’s twisting expressions, Daniel leaned in. “I’m proud of you Kyle. Not letting Clay get to you and facing your fears.”

How little he knew. “I’m not scared,” Kyle instantly yelped.

Daniel sighed. He found it difficult to read Kyle’s moods but always felt compelled to help him. He wrapped one arm around his little brother, gave reassuring squeeze with his thick hand. One long moment later, he finally pulled away. Daniel’s concern released some of Kyle’s tension. Unlike Clay, Daniel would rough house with Kyle, but never intentionally hurt him.

A horrifying laugh buzzed across the mechanical speakers. The car lurched toward the darkness ahead. Kyle instantly tensed again, his hands gripping the cold steel. All of the blood quickly drained out of his face and knuckles. Soon, the darkness consumed them.

Over the next several minutes, haunting flashes and specters terrorized the delighted visitors. Well, all but Kyle. Every bump and scream tensed his thin body more and more. He did all he could to hold his breath, not to give Clay the satisfaction of hearing his screams.

His skin crawled with each passing minute. Kyle’s clothes creeped across his skin, uncomfortably gripping him in several places. Even his shoes pinched as his big toes like the claws of a preying mantis. The haunted house must have been getting to him more than he thought. Despite all of the commotion around them, Daniel noticed Kyle’s squirming and tight grip on the bar.

“Not much longer now,” Daniel reassured him with his baritone voice.

“Not soon enough!” Kyle screamed in his mind, clenching his jaw shut.

Finally, the light at the end of the tunnel emerged. Kyle continued to squirm, still feeling his clothes constrict around him. He had hoped seeing the end of the ride would calm him, but he had used every last ounce of strength to not let out horrified screams. More over, the itching of his clothes was driving him mad.

He had to escape this car!

The ride barely came to a stop. Sweat had visibly beaded across Kyle's forehead and the moment the leg bar released, Kyle shoved it away, sprinting down the wooden stairs away from the glaring lights of the haunted house. He had moved so fast, Daniel lost sight of him. Kyle huffed and puffed, doubling over his legs. The crowd mindlessly moved around him, unaware this inconvenient obstacle was a frightened boy.

He hated the dark.

He hated fear.

And he hated Clay.

“Ready for another?” Clay’s voice taunted from behind.

“Enough Clay,” Daniel said.

As the two of them bickered, Craig found his brother and weaved his way through the thick crowd of thrill seekers. Once he finally made it through, Craig’s enlarged hazel eyes transfixed on Kyle. He readjusted his thick black framed glasses, just to make sure he wasn’t seeing things. Kyle was still bent over, his back heaving up and down in the air. But Craig wasn't looking at Kyle’s back, he was looking at Kyle’s ankles.

Kyle's smooth, pale skin was impossibly exposed. The bottom of his pant legs had rode up several inches to the base of his undefined calves.

“Kyle?” Craig said.

Despite the crowd’s chatter, Kyle heard Craig’s monotone voice. He slowed his breaths, straightened up and turned. At first, Kyle thought he was mistaken. A pair of thin eyebrows starred greeted Kyle’s gaze. It took him a moment to Kyle adjusted and realize he was now looking down at his “taller” brother Craig.

15311.content:
Craig was now a few inches shorter than Kyle. Craig’s hazel eyes were always one size too big, magnified by the bowed glass in their frames. But now, they continued to widen in disbelief as Kyle’s grew with silent amazement.

“How is this possible?” Craig’s wheezed.

Kyle tensed and froze. The image of the card’s stopwatch flashed in his mind. The old man handing him the trio of cards skipped over and over again like a scratched disc.

Craig slowly eyed his brother up and down with continued disbelief. He adjusted his glasses once, twice, then three times , sure that this was some trick of the light.

“This is unprecedented, Kyle! Look at you...”

Craig gestured to Kyle’s pants, still processing all the ways this could possibly be some dramatic trick of light. Kyle finally looked down and saw what Craig saw. His pants were riding up his legs, revealing his calves. His faded graphic t-shirt looked almost form-fitting now, the bottom stopping just above the copper button of his pants, while the arms clung tight around his biceps.

Kyle flexed his arm back and forth, watching the fabric tug, but never relax. “I don’t think I’ve worn something this small since Daniel’s hand-me-down’s in fourth grade. You remember, right? You and Clay got the bigger set and, as always I got the leftovers. ”

The world grew transparent to Craig, as he mentally walked through the long halls of his knowledge and memory. His stoic expression never wavered, but could not mask his growing interest. “In all the books I have ever read there has never been an instance of sudden growth like this.”

Kyle blinked. “Are you sure, Craig? Never?”

“Fiction, yes. Non-fiction? No.”

“First time for everything,” Kyle lit up, lifting his heels up and down, flexing the tightening band around his legs.

Craig slowly shook his head with his eyes unblinking. “I’m sure something like this has been recorded at some point in human history. Growing several inches over a year, yes. Months, sure, for pubescent teens. But to grow several inches in a matter of minutes...?”

Kyle continued exploring his body with childlike wonder. He flexed his fingers, bringing them up to his chest and slowly clenched them into a fist. His sleeves tugged. “And it’s happening to me,” Kyle’s voice hummed.

“Just imagine what this could mean for medical science!” Craig’s eyes remained blurred behind those possibilities. “You could hold the key to reliably stimulating human growth plates. Imagine the kind of impact this could have on controlling cell reproduction and—“

He stopped. Craig stepped closer to Kyle, his nose almost touching Kyle’s chin. “You could still be growing.”

“You think?” Kyle’s voice cracked.

“We may not know why this started but that does not mean that whatever ‘this’ is has stopped yet. You could keep growing, be five foot five, even six feet tall in a matter of days! Maybe hours!”

Kyle’s green eyes shimmered at the thought. “Six feet tall. Me! The ‘short’ brother,” he laughed. “No more hand-me-downs for this guy!”

“Well,” Craig corrected, “at the very least, you will be at the front of the line, not being the shortest among us any longer.”

That thought struck Kyle like a lightning bolt.

“You’re right, Craig. I’m not the short brother anymore!”

Kyle’s face visibly darkened. He took one long lunge past Craig. His new mission materialized before him, but before he could march one step further, Craig halted him with a hand on Kyle’s broadening shoulder.

“You ARE still growing.”

“I am?!” Kyle responded with a crackling giddy.

Kyle new “mission” instantly vanished, soaking in the subtle changes between a few minutes ago and now. Kyle’s dog-like focus always sent him zooming full throttle from one idea to the next. The cat he had set upon chasing was instantly replaced by his own delicious looking tail, so to speak.

“You must be!,” Craig began, clearing his thickly matted hair away from his face. “A minute ago, my eyes were in line with your lips. Now I can barely see over your shoulder!”

“I think you might be right, my shoes are getting really tight around my feet.” Kyle tried to wiggle his toes, but the bulging fabric locked each digit in place.

“Certainly.” Craig replied, “You’ve roughly grown 6 inches since we got on the ride. That was 10 or so minutes ago now. Which means those size sevens are quickly getting too small for your rapidly growing feet. It won’t be long before they just…”

“What?” Kyle asked.

Craig pointed down at Kyle’s feet. Some of the seams on top of Kyle’s white and blue tennis shoes were already ripped.

“Holy crap!” Kyle exclaimed.

Craig grabbed Kyle by the arm, noticing it felt thicker than it seemed and lead his brother under a nearby tree. The pool of light surrounding the rides and stands abandoned them here. “We cannot tell these people about this,” Craig urgently said in a hushed voice.

Kyle wrenched his arm away from Craig, looking even further down to his shrinking brother. “And why not! This is amazing!”

“Amazing for now,” Craig whispered, rising to his tippy toes. “But if there is ONE thing I know about medical science is that they are NOT going to have YOUR best interest at heart.”

“Again with the ‘medical science’ thing.”

Craig rose even further, putting his mouth within half an inch of Kyle’s ear. Craig’s Willy Wonka like friz tickled Kyle’s cheek. Kyle giggled, but Craig’s serious edge remaind. “You just grew 6 inches in 10 minutes. You are obviously still growing. If you prove to be some kind of miracle, they will take you apart piece by piece to find out what makes you tick! And all of these people…”

Silence.

“…are their spies.”

Kyle back flattened against the tree. A cold chill crept up his spine as his shirt uncomfortably tugged at his arm pits. “No way,” Kyle hushed.

Craig nodded with a knowing dread before lowering himself back to the ground. “People flock to the unusual and this certainly qualifies as--”

RIP!

Both boys looked down as Kyle’s feet ripped more of his shoes away.

“--unusual,” Craig concluded.

Kyle could not reconcile the sheer amazement, and now prickling dread he felt. “How big do you think I am right now, Craig?”

Craig took a step back, sizing up his growing brother. Kyle’s navel peeked out from underneath his tightening shirt. “You are several inches taller than you were. Almost a foot taller than me I would say,” he paused, “5 foot 5 inches. Give or take.”

Kyle slowly pushed off the tree, back on his own two, growing feet. The movement pinched his toes, forcing them to rip more of his shoe apart. His white socks were now clearly exposed in several places they shouldn’t be all along the top of his foot.

“And I am still growing,” Kyle said assured.

Kyle drove his heels into the ground with a mighty THOOM! Gravity rolled Craig back along Kyle’s thigh, tumbling off the side and plummeting ten feet to the ground.

Kyle felt and saw none of this, consumed by his growing anger. Daniel’s betrayal burned deeper than he had ever thought possible. Kyle lunged forward with heavy, ground-shaking steps. The whole area quaked as the 100-foot teen took his temper further and further away from his broken brothers.

Daniel laid helpless in the ten-foot pit a few feet away from Clay, sobbing silent sobs. He fought to catch his breath, repeating one question over and over in his mind.

What have I done?

Originally by nightwolf285 (66) , posted with permission

Kyle drove his heels as hard as he could into the ground with each step he took. Nearby deer and other wildlife scattered in any direction they could, instinctively fearing the menace rocking the landscape.

Kyle could no longer make out most of the finer details below him, despite how much brighter everything was now. Dawn was not far away. He knew the ground was mostly grass and dirt. The green and brown smudges showed him that, but that was all. The little rocks and blades of grass he trampled with each massive step went otherwise unnoticed.

With a sudden surge of anger, Kyle jumped into the air and drove his weight as hard as he could into the ground over and over again. Fissures broke open and quickly snaked out in all direction like breaking glass. New ridged and chasms formed, each several feet high and several feet deep. What was a simple tantrum for Kyle wrought cataclysmic effects for half a mile in all directions. He dropped to his knees, and beating the ground with his fists, cracking half an acre of otherwise barren land into increasingly more rigid and distorted shapes.

Kyle could not confront Daniel’s betrayal without his blood boiling. The one person that had defended and protected him had been lying all along. He wanted to take away the ONE thing that made him special. At least Craig understood…

“Where’s Craig?!”

He patted himself down as if he would find his brother in some phantom pocket before realizing he must be back where he left Clay and Daniel.

“DAMN IT!”

What had he done to Craig? He had been on his leg before, but what now? Had he crushed him when he stormed off? And his brothers? Kyle never saw them hit bottom in that hole he had dug. The possible ramifications of Kyle’s simplest actions worried and infuriated him even further.

Kyle’s frustration mounted inside of him. His body shook with fury as he howled with blinding rage at the empty vista. He slammed his hands into the ground, forcing himself back on his feet and moved with hurried stomps.

Each step pounded deeper and deeper into the earth. Kyle’s body continued to grow, slowly filling the otherwise empty landscape with his thickening form. He was growing an inch taller every two seconds now. From Kyle’s perspectives, the changes felt just as subtle as they did when this all began. But it was becoming easier to visualize the difference with each passing moment. His feet filled more and more of the ground as they thickened and widened. His legs propelled him up higher and higher into the air, putting the distant city into better view.

“The city…”

Images of every grade school and middle school bully flooded his mind. That was HIS city just ahead. He had just shown Daniel and Clay what it was like to mess with him, but what about the rest of them? They shouldn’t escape all the pain they had given him over the years just because they were a few more miles away.

Kyle felt a sudden prickle in the heel of his foot, bringing him to a stop. He lifted up his foot, snapping several power lines instantly before realizing what the dark smudge on his heel was. Kyle dropped his foot back to the ground, instantly crushing another wooden pole and transformer. The sparking electricity shot out across the empty two lane street, tickling Kyle’s feet.

Kyle’s raging anger ebbed for a moment with child-like wonder. His foot was longer than an entire two lane street. The power lines rode just above his ankles and the time-worn asphalt crumbled under his weight. The whole scene reminded him of a large, plastic city mat he had played with as a child. He and would craft little buildings all along it made from LEGOs and then stomp around the mat like Godzilla. And this time… it was for real.

He watched his own feet envelop the road more and more.. His toes broke beyond the other side, stretching back onto the dirt. His feet widened and uprooted more poles from either side of the street. The wooden beams looked as thin as tooth picked to the gigantic twelve-year-old.

The forest just beyond the road glittered in the morning light as the sun finally broke above the horizon. Even the tallest trees only came up to Kyle’s knees now. The gigantic boy stepped closer to what appeared to him as mere shrubs. Was this the forest he was running around in earlier as he dogged the farmer’s fire?

Kyle took another step, crushing his massive foot upon several of the nearby trees unfortunate enough to have been growing so close to him. While the branches offered more resistance than the power lines, they too bent and snapped under his weight. Hundreds of birds instantly fluttered into the air, swarming around Kyle’s thigh before bolting in the opposite direction.

He took a few more steps into the forest, excited by how small it all was now. Before today, trees WERE the giants. Now HE was… and he liked it. The trees surrendered faster and faster with each step, shrinking away from the boy as both his growth and his movement continued to accelerate.

The rays of the sun continued to increase, and Kyle looked back at the long shadow he cast behind him, stretching back to the mountains. Ahead of him, he could see the smaller buildings of the outskirts of town leading to the taller skyscrapers in the inner city. Most of the smaller ones he had already eclipsed in height. And soon, he thought, none of them will be able to rise above me.

The thought brought his already semi-hard cock to rigid attention. He resisted the urge to touch it, for now, and continued to make his way forward, his presence already being detected by those in the city...

1532.content:
...the one with the calendar. Although a part of him wanted the idea to get big fast, he didn't want to grow TOO fast that it would draw attention, but the eternal option seemed like it would be too slow for his liking. He was willing to wait a year for his growth, and enjoy every day of it. Quietly he slipped the card into his pocket for safe keeping. He was still a little doubtful that it would work, but a kid could dream couldn't he?

For the next hour Kyle followed his brothers on rides and carnival games, but his focus kept on going to his watch. The man had said he would grow every hour with this card, but so far he hasn't noticed a thing at all. Was he already bigger? Has it already been an hour yet? Kyle waited breathlessly as it got closer and closer, the minutes ticking down on his watch. He felt his heart beat fast as it finally gotten to the last minute. Kyle told his brothers he needed to use the restroom and slipped away, anxious to get his first growth. He looked down at the watch, his heart beating fast as the seconds ticked down.

57...58...59...

The exact moment it hit 1 Kyle felt something like butterflies in his stomach and a slight sense of vertigo. Excited, he checked himself, looking himself over trying to see a difference. He didn't find anything different however.

Was the card really bogus after all? Or was it so small he couldn't notice? Kyle remembered then that the man said he would only grow 1% at a time. Of course it was so small he couldn't notice.

"Dammit, maybe I should have picked the first card." Kyle muttered. At least then he wouldn't have to wait in anxiety for results. Feeling a bit dejected, he headed back to his brothers. On the way, he passed by a height marker for a ride. Curious, he stood next to it and measured his height. He had had it measured at the last ride, so he knew he was 4'8" even. When he measured himself now, however, he found himself closer to 4 foot eight and a half inches.

Did he really just grow half an inch? Or was he just being hopeful? His heart started beating faster at the thought. If he grew half an inch in just an hour, then in a few hours how much will he grow? A bit excited again, Kyle rejoined his brothers with a slight grin on his face.

After squeezing in one more ride, Kyle and his brothers headed home. When no one was looking, he marked his height on the wall to measure his progress, then went to bed, already eager to see how much he'll have grown in the morning.

The next day was Saturday, and as such, both Kyle and his brothers all slept in until well after nine o' clock (after all, they had stayed out rather late at the fair). Kyle was the first one to wake up, excited to see if the change in height was noticeable after a few hours.

He didn't even have to go check height mark he had made on the wall the previous night to know something was different; his pajamas all felt tighter, especially around his crotch, where a full morning wood seemed significantly more pronounced than before. As he did go check the wall, though, he was delighted to see that the mark he had made was now closer to his neck than to the top of his head. He had grown over five inches since going to bed, and was now definitely taller than Craig and Clay. "I might even start having to borrow Daniel's clothes for a while," he thought to himself with a grin. "At least, while I still fit in them!"

Deciding to change into some looser fitting clothes, he paused to look in the full-length mirror in his bedroom as he peeled off his shirt and pants. The growth spurt didn't seem to have any affect on his muscles, at least for now. The bulge in his underwear definitely seemed more pronounced, though Kyle couldn't quite tell if that was just an effect of his overall growth or something else.

"Holy crap!" Kyle turned around and smiled as he saw Craig putting on his glasses, gawking at him. HIs exclamation woke up Clay as well, and the two boys jumped out of bed and walked over to him, both staring up at their suddenly-taller brother. "What happened to you, Kyle?"

Kyle beamed in return. "Oh, this is just the beginning, believe me. You better prepare yourself for some big changes around here."

Neither brother knew what to make of that, and simply shook their heads and went off down the stairs to the kitchen. Kyle folded his arms across his still-bare chest, still amazed by what he saw-- just as he felt the sense of vertigo again, and his clothes became ever-so-tighter.
